review: Yup! Not a big fan of pizza but cpk is the only exception. We went on a busy Monday night after new year. Place was pretty packed but  the wait wasn't so bad (original plan was to go to cheesecake factory to spend a gift card but wait time was way too long).. Resto has relaxing ambiance, simple decor, warm lights.. Staffs were polite and server not mia.  Anyhow menu-wise, i highly recommend:       Artichoke dip wit chips - served warm, chips not salty       Jamaican jerk pizza - spicy, sweet, hot. Bacon adds crisp and saltiness.       We also had chicken tequila fettuccine - it is worth trying but not my favorite amongst pasta selection.. Although I prefer this over the jambalaya pasta..  If u wanna try their signature original BBQ chicken pizza , i suggest having it on thin crust.. the BBQ sauce is too strong for my taste.. Never liked BBQ sauce in the first place.. Artichoke + spinach on thin crust is also good (i guess im a big fan of their artichoke recipe).. I tried both these pizzas in emeryville branch.. I don't think there'll be any difference. All in all, cpk is an above average pizza place.. service and menu is upto par and worth going to if u have extra bucks to spare..

everything was as expected.  At our table we had 3 adults and 2 kids. They were very accommodating to my then whiny 2 1/2 year old.  They brought crayons, book and snacks for him.  They also brought him his food as soon as it was up and ready.  All of our pizzas were good and we didn't feel rushed.  Will  go here again.

This place is def. NOT kid friendly.  I told the host 3 adults and 1 high chair, she sits us down in a booth, doesn't bring a high chair. Then I went to get a high chair myself and the host came up to us like the high chair police and said we have to move because it can't be in an isle. Whatever- i've been a waitress for many years and never have been told its a fire hazard for a little high chair to be in the isle. So whatever we move, the service was slow, they strangely had no sliced cheese to go on a sandwhich and the food was over priced and not good... Wasn't a happy camper and i'll never go back.

I came here with two friends after we wandered around the mall looking for something to eat, and we decided to come to cpk. I'm definitely coming back! The kitchen is this large open space at the back where you can see everything going on-it looks like a live action episode of top chef, which I like because you get to see everything the chefs are doing. I ordered Vegetarian with Japanese eggplant, and my friends ordered the Meat-lovers pizza and the chicken alfredo. All of them were really good. My pizza had these huge gigantic almost tree-size pieces of broccoli, which to some people might be a turn off but I love broccoli and it looked really nice on the pizza. The only bad thing I would say is that I didn't notice the Japanese eggplant; I felt like they needed to embellish the fact it was "Japanese" and "exotic" to justify the price-$11. The meat-lover's pizza was amaaazing. I feel like its worth more to buy a meatier pizza than the vegetable ones because my pizza was meh compared to my friend's. Our service was amazing! Our server was always friendly, smiling, attentive, and would tell us not to be rushed or things like that. She always checked up on us and asked us if we needed refills, parmesan, etc. That alone would be great service. The best part was when she came by and gave me a pizza, then apologizes because the kitchen accidently made the crust too thin, so she gave me the pizza to much on while I wait for the  . Whoa. That is awesome service. So when it came time to pay the bill I felt incredibly guilty because we only had three twenty dollar bills between us so our tip didn't match what I felt was an amazing service. I'm giving major bonus points to our awesome server and if I get her again the next time I come here I'll make sure to give her a generous tip!

Got the steak tacos and probably should have stuck with a pizza or salad because they were very unimpressive. However, their Apple crisp dessert with ice cream and caramel is to die for! Just stick to the basics and Cpk's forte (pizza&salads) and you're golden

service was amazing! my server was brittany and she was charming n very informative about the menu options! the food was exquisite i definitely recommend the sicilian! the hosts  greet u and wish u a great night on the way out! cant wait to go again!

The servers, employees, and service is good.  They are attentive and nice.  However unless, you are under twelve, you will not like the taste of the pizzas.  They taste like cardboard with ketchup.  What little toppings they have are rare and bland.  Pastas are ok but the portions are small and expensive.  Go to a real Italian restaurant.
The food is great! And service is excellent!!  Must try: avocado egg rolls, dynamite shrimps and crispy Mac n cheese Tiramisu is better than expected!

If only I could give zero stars....  45 minute wait to be seated another 25 to take my order another 35 for the food to actally come out The food that came out was ice cold pasta Notified our server and she went to get the piece of s*** manager. He had the nerve to cop an attitude and argue with us about how long we were waiting. We told him an hour and 45, he said no... only an hour and a half....  At LEAST he could have been apologetic. It's not MY fault he's 45 and working at CPK....  Needless to say we got up and walked out. I will NEVER return.

The food was always good here. I loved the one in Emeryville so I thought I would love the one here. Service has always been a problem for the one here though it would seem. Maybe it was just the waiters/waitresses that we got but 3 times the service just wasn't what you would expect from the Emeryville one. They were all either not very responsive or they wouldn't give us the things that you would normally expect without asking such as bread, water refills, etc. The food was up to standard though and the place was pretty clean since it is still new. Overall it's not a negative experience aside from the service.

So the girls working in the hostess area are all very nice and pleasant. Everyone working in the take-out booth are all very friendly. The bitchy servers that I've gotten the last two times has brought this place down to 2 stars. Luckily, there are other places to eat in Pleasanton. That's why CPK is at the bottom of my list for nights where we feel like dining in. If I want to be miserable I'll go and get a root canal. I'm not going to waste my money on a tip for those bitchy waitresses. It's all very easy! If you don't want to be a waitress or if you don't want to work at CPK then DON'T! I highly recommend some type of training or re-training of the waitresses that work there. SERIOUSLY. Ok, so if I only stick to the take out service then this place might get a 4 star rating. :)
Great food , great service.   A bit pricey ($13 for a personal pizza, $9.50 for a half salad) though.  Thank god for kids meals.

Came here this evening for dinner and finally tried the Kung Pao spaghetti with chicken. I'm not much into spicy food but really wanted to try this so requested for a mild version. The spaghetti was still spicy and had an OK taste to it- nothing special, I was expecting more after reading how popular it is! There was also barely any chicken in it...not worth the $13 for this dish. Otherwise my bf ordered the Meat Cravers pizza which I usually order which was still yummy....go for the pizzas not the pasta!
Tortilla Baja chicken rolls, are superb! Great customer service.  P.s Get the peach lemonade:)
food is "grrrrreat". the wife and i had the chicken garlic pizza and it was amazing. chips and guac, tortilla bahamas chicken rolls were awesome. and very good customer service.
Been here a few times, usually end up getting the same thing. The white pizza with artichoke hearts added, yummyyyyy! Good variety of food and drinks, prices are moderate as well.
Jerk at the hostess desk, possibly a manager, he is so freaking RUDE and I feared he may have tampered with my food, that's how sketchy he came off. 1 star for the waitress who was sweet.

On June 16, 2012 I went to CPK with my family and ordered the BBQ Chicken Pizza & half a chopped salad. Around 2am the next morning (June 17th.)  the pain in my stomach started. After 15 trips to the toilet by 6am i was not too happy with CPK's Pleasanton Kitchen. Now it's 9:30pm (29 hours later) and the cramping has not gone away - I did get a couple of breaks in the cramping along the way, but whenever  I eat something they come back and off to the toilet I run... Thanks CPK Pleasantion for the wonderful Father's Day gift :( I hope it's not the Noro Virus that got the Walnut Creek Store...

location: East Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: It's been ages since I've been in here. In fact, this is the first time I've been in CPK since its been remodeled. I like that it's much more spacious and an actual restaurant compared to the old location. We had to wait for a bit, but once our server, Julian took our order, it was very quick. My mom and I ordered the Quinoa Salad and the smashed pea and barley soup. We split both which was the perfect meal for each of us to try. I think I'm a fan of the quinoa salad which is a new item on the menu. The service was attentive and quick. Julian brought us some bread and even went above and beyond for us when we didn't ask for it. The food is normally about 3-stars but since discovering the quinoa salad and the good service, I'm bumping up my rating.
This place has excepcional service and Food !! Thanks Andrew and Michael :)

California Pizza Kitchen has a very eclectic menu so even the pickiest of eaters will find something to eat.  This is a good place for a group of people that have different preferences.  Even though it is a PIZZA kitchen there are also salads, pastas, tacos, sandwiches, and a large variety of traditional and non-traditional pizzas.  We started with the avocado egg rolls, which is a great appetizer for all.  The 6 egg rolls come fried with avocado, chicken, and bacon inside.  The platter also comes with a side of ranch dressing and a chipotle ranch dressing, which is delicious on the rolls.  Next, I ordered the 2 fish tacos, which are grilled well and are slightly breaded.  Overall the tacos were flavorful, but need that extra spice of some Cholula because the salsa it comes with is not that great.  It also comes with a side of blue corn chips, which are nothing special.  My boyfriend got the BBQ Chicken Pizza, which he added pineapple and bacon and his pizza was delicious!  There was just enough BBQ sauce and the pineapple really complemented the sauce and chicken.  One of the other guys got the Greek Pizza, which comes with a side of tsaziki sauce.  The Greek Pizza looked amazing!  It had cucumbers, tomatoes, kalamata olives, onions, and feta cheese.  It was basically a Greek salad on top of a pizza...delicious!  My other friend got the spaghetti bolognese, which looked good, but he said it was just ok.  The service was great and our waiter was very knowledgable of the menu and gave great suggestions!
Becoming fan. One of my favorite places to dine. There is always some wait period (especially weekends) but love the food.

We have been to this location a couple of times and since this location opened with the "old" CPK menu (read-the miso shrimp or chicken salad), I was a team player in coming. Kevin likes the pizza here, I am not a fan. Service at this location has always been friendly and for a change from Cheesecake Factory it has been okay.
Nice staff. Good food. Nothing else to really say.. but I'm always down for CPK.

Today was a great day at CPK!    Walked in and the hostess stands had three girls ready to please me as well as the store manager delegating. We sat in a few minutes but I heard the wait averaged fifteen minutes, our leader was hostess Nichole and she was courteous and attentive and her word of the day was "Awesome".     We had not even gotten comfortable and our waitress Karen showed up to get us water and get food started, the food timing and taste was fantastic.    Several other employee's checked on us during our visit but Karen was a lot of server in a little five-foot package, also the place looked well staffed and everyone looked happy!    Food;    We started with Sesame Dumplings and had Split Pea soup and a Whole Wheat crust Artichoke Spinach reg crust pizza with Bacon added -YUM!!!    We already went though the menu and have our meals planned for the next FOUR Times!      Go here - Nice and Organized!

Came here with a party of 9 and was surprised. They have tiny portions which are pretty gay. The bread sticks had a little too much flour and they were slightly underdone. I can't really complain good pizza decent bread sticks, nice decor. Nothing really spectacular but our waiter was pretty nice and was constantly refilling our drinks and stuff.

I think I'm a fan of the ASAP CPK we used to have in the mall. I understand, there's more choices and a full bar with the regular CPK. But the prices are higher, yet I'm getting the same thing I picked out at the ASAP. I've only been here once since it became a sit down restaurant...not sure if I'm a fully convinced fan...

Went to CPK on Friday night at 7pm, there wasn't a wait and we were seated right away. Our server Greg was awesome, a bit rushed, but super friendly and full of information.  The food is a bit over priced considering you are at a glorified fast fod chain , but the service and hospitality was friendly and fast, which is what is saving them, because the food was only "okay".

Much thanks to this place for taking on a fundraiser for my church youth group.  Not the cheapest place and you might have to wait a bit, but the food and service are great.  Quite the extensive menu too!

I hadn't been to a CPK since I was a kid - I was surprised to see the menu - when I used to go it was mostly pizza and salads.  They have a much better menu these days, so much so I had some amazing pasta. I would definitely come back here for lunch

The new CPK is a joke. I got better service and food from the old CPK ASAP. After sitting for over 8mins our waiter finally approached us to order our drinks. Ordered a chips and guacamole appetizer and they brought me only 4 chips. I ordered spaghetti for lunch and it came with barely any sauce and not fully-cooked pasta. This was my 2nd time giving CPK restaurant a chance and I am still disappointed. No more chances from me.

Took my husband here for a pre-dinner before a b-day outing at TommyT's. The waitress service was wonderful, BUT the manager who was not accommodating to my group of 15 people was not! He was going to make us sit at separate tables, claiming he couldn't accommodate the group (fyi, the table fold out!), he wouldn't allow us to reserve seating, despite us coming in to pre-order food! The food is ehhh, ok. I had the BBQ pizza which was alright. So why the 3 stars you ask? The butter cake covered with vanilla ice cream! It is worth every moment of drama we had with that manger. No joke, it is not a game! It comes warm, with light sea salt (sounds weird, but it's great) and home made whip cream. Now I HATE whip cream, but this was a totally different experience-light, fluffy and doesn't leave that film in your mouth that store bout whip leaves behind (blahhh!).  3 stars for some dang good cake!

Boyfriend & I came here a few weeks ago. We come to CPK about once every month and a half. I love to come on Yelp and praise people, but today I just couldn't. Our server was Chelsea, and I haven't been this disappointed with restaurant service in a while (and I'm a server so I'm very lenient!). I went through my water by the time our appetizer came, so she refilled it.  Then went through my 2nd glass by the time our entrees arrived.  You would think this would be a clue that I'm quite thirsty.. but she didn't even check on us once until we were finished with our meals, and while I waited 20 minutes for another water. I had to ask the manager for a refill because she had disappeared the entire time. We were obviously her last table and she just wanted to get out of there, but we both are servers..she would have gotten a 25% tip.  But we settled for a decent tip. 4 stars for the restaurant.  I would dock off another star for service, but our service is actually usually pretty decent. But next time we'll ask who our server is before sitting down.

I called and was told by the girl that answered that they do accommodate birthday parties and was transferred to the manager.  I told him I had a party for 15 kids and he told me that they only book birthday parties (even for weekends) at 10:00 am.  HE didn't even sound sure of his answer  Are you kidding me?  You would think they'd jump on auto tip right?  I guess not.  I'll take my money elsewhere.

Smh , you know it's all bad when, they say its a 15 min wait turns into 30. Then the waitress says we might run out of pizza dough.  BTW, most of the kid's menu was is unavailable too. Unbelievable . No buzzing pagers, so people who are on their smartphone and not listening when their name gets called out will not get seated which is their fault. Barely anyplace to wait. No outside heaters like Cheesecake factory which was about an hour's wait on a Thursday night 12/28/12. Place was really really loud. If I feel they get their act together, then I will patronize this place, not anytime soon. I felt like I was in the show Restaurant Impossible?Undercover Restaurant where the employees are behaving badly.

Totally one of my favorite places to eat at. It is a well organized and well staffed location. Of course you bill will tell you that in the end but it is so so worth it.  We stopped bye during the xmas shopping spree and were totally cool by the wait time of 15 min.  Ordered a peperoni pizza along with a BBQ Chicken Salad and the assistant ordered the Waldorf salad. She wasn't too happy with all of the goat cheese they put on it but the rest of us were.  Overall we were very happy

Every time I've eaten here I've been disappointed. This last time I ate here my chicken hadn't even touched a grill, my salad had the wrong dressing and the avocado was BROWN. And the beets that I specifically asked for were absent from the meal. The fish tacos were extremely dry and flavorless. This place won't be getting another chance.
Cant really complain about it, as always it's a busy restaurant so we cant expect the service to be good. after all a 3 star.

We haven't gone to a CPK since their Norovirus outbreak in Walnut Creek six months ago. Hubby picked up take-out at their curbside service tonight since I'm at home with a pinched nerve in my neck. I ordered two bowls of Tortilla soup and a Chicken BBQ salad. I called back to ask for extra bread and ended up getting a Call Center at some undisclosed location. The guy was a bit confused but nice enough. My husband comes home with the order  No extra bread, no tortilla strips for the lukewarm "tortilla" soup and very little chicken on the salad. Quite disappointing. We will think twice before we go back.

I used to work here and was just recently let go due to "over staffing". I'll give an honest review since I was a server and a bartender at this location. The bread is by request only. They don't offer it to you. If you want some ASK for it. Don't complain that nobody asked you if you wanted it or read your mind and brought you some. Use your words. Another useful trick is their alcohol. If you want your drink a double just tell the server to make the drink a double and it only costs $1 more. The pizzas are good. Pastas are average and take too long. Salads are big. Asian plum martini is good. Mojitos are good. Be nice to your servers and tip them well. They do a lot more things behind the scenes than at most restaurants. If the service is slow it's the kitchen not the waiter.

My younger daughter loves this place, so whenever we go for shopping; we make a point to have meal here. Stoneridge mall CPK has been now converted into full sitting restaurant and that is a real good change. We used to go to Valley fair since that was the formal one, but the Stoneridge mall CPK is even better, bigger and new. Must give a try.

This CPK is really busy during dinner time. The noise level can get quite high to a point where I can't really have a great conversation with whom I'm dining with. Other than the noise issue, I did enjoy their Miso Shrimp Salad which is the only thing worth mentioning. The waitress was friendly, but seemed to be overwhelmed multitasking between tables. I wouldn't mind returning, but will be avoiding rush hour at all costs.

Kudos to the awesome customer service we received from the Manager last night.  My husband had a small issue with how his pasta was cooked and they promptly took care of it. The only bummer was me ordering my favorite Thai Chicken Pizza and thinking I would have leftovers the next day.  Nope!  I devoured the whole delicious thing right there.   Plus their new salted caramel pudding is so good.

Overrated pizza. I ordered the thin crust pizza, it was basically a crispy quesadilla without the top tortilla on it, frickin BS. The Avocado Egg Rolls did rule though.  Chill service, chill environment.
We love CPK - but we have found extremely bad service at this location the two times we have tried it. They have lost us as customers.

Got the $10 off of $40 coupon from the website. We decided to give it a try. After seated for 15 min, no one attended to us. There were a lot of waiters passing by. Just seems no one was assigned to our table. We had to flag down one and asked for service. Fortunately, everything went upwards since then. This is the reason I deduct a point.  We ordered Sesame Ginger Chicken Dumplings. The dumplings skin is thin but strong enough not to break when you pick it from the plate. The sauce was a bit sweet but on the good side. Habanero Carnitas original crust pizza in honey wheat dough is another good one. There was supposed to be a very spicy salsa. But we asked to skip that. The pizza toppings were still a bit spicy but was gent and not biting. The pizza tasted very good but a little greasy.  The thing we liked the most was Jambalaya Fettuccine. It came with shrimp, blackened chicken, crawfish in cajun sauce. It did come a little kick but was super enjoyable. Highly recommend it. To make $40 in total, we also ordered refillable mango lemonade and peachy ice tea. Both were ok. But you can certainly taste those artificial flavored syrup.  The service was very attentive. The coupon deal is great. The food is wonderful. Will certainly come again.
I don't know what the hype is about CPK.  I'd rather have pizza delivered to my house.  The pizza isn't even good here!!!

I'm a long time CPK fan, and I have to say, the inside service is ok, but the to-go (curbside pick-up) service is AMAZING.  They're fast and efficient, and if they even think they've done something wrong, they fix it for you.  Note to self though, if you're doing a take-out order, make sure to talk to someone at the location, not the service center line you end up getting transferred to. Oh, and they've changed their bread to a sourdough that's cooked all day long on-site, it's really good.  Just an overall fan of this place.

Food is as expected of any other CPK ( I've eaten at their branches all over and outside the US and the taste never differs ). The service on this other hand is horrible. The waiter guy had a sour face all along and treated us like we were crashing his party. I'd rather get takeout than suffer irritating looks from a prick of a waiter the next time.
I might be biased (since I love artichokes) but I literally come here every time I shop at Stoneridge for the roasted artichoke and spinach pizza. Delicious.

Come in on team lunch, after work drinks, dinner if work goes late... service and food is above average but nothing to WOW about...  To all the servers, keep up the good work. It's the reason why our employees come here over other places.

Stopped their for birthday lunch. Our server was good and friendly. Ordered spicy chipotle chicken pizza. Definitely hit the mark! Grilled veggie sandwich was just ok, little too dry. We have been there few times and would visit again!

If you've been to one CPK, then you've pretty much been to all. The menu has good variety and the salads are probably my favorite items. The pizzas are good sized and are good for the money. Service has always been friendly an prompt.

The food was good, the service was not. Chelsea took my order, refilled my drink after walking past me (and my empty glass) several times. She was good at placing the drink on the table without ever stopping, looking at me, or asking how my meal was. She brought my check to me as I was finishing my food. I had planned on getting dessert, but that was apparently not an option. I got a terse, "Have a good night," as she dropped my check and credit card at my table, again without ever stopping. Maybe she was having a bad night, maybe she was annoyed she had to serve a table with only one person. If the service is bad, there's no reason to come back no matter how good the food might be - and the food here is good, but not worth an ornery waitress.

We absolutely love this cpk located at stoneride mall.  It can get crowded and have to wait for a table especially if you arrive around dinner time.  Caramelized Peach Salad is one of our favorites and is very delicious.  They also have a kids menu with a good selection of choices.  My son loves the fusilli with tomato sauce and the portion is very good.  The service can vary depending on which server you will get but its usually pretty good.  Kid friendly as well.
Good thing I didn't go for the customer service.  The food was what I would expect for a chain restaurant.

Love their Kung Pow Spaghetti, however, sometimes they really under cook the noodle.  When I take it to the waitress, the kitchen made a new plate.   Great pizza selections.  Great location and it can get crowded during the weekend.

Used to always get their delicious pizzas before changing to a low carb diet. Fortunately they have several suitable dishes. Bad news is the portion sizes are now laughably small. Ordered the chicken chimichurri today and it arrived with what appeared to be 2 oz of chicken. I almost thought I had the kids version, but no such dish exists. Never again, waste of money.

I was tempted to give this place 5 stars since I've never had a bad meal here but I just tend not to give 5's to chains.  But, as I said, never had a bad meal here. Very consistent. I'm a big fan of their pear and gorgonzola thin crust pizza, mushroom pizza and BBQ chicken chopped salad, with avocado and an extra side of BBQ :)  Egg roll appetizers are not that great. Spinach dip on the other hand is awesome, but probably a heart attack in a bowl!  Tip: avoid the long wait by sitting at the bar if there are seats open. Bartenders are nice there and the service is efficient, plus they have sports on the TV.
The food was great and Jeanell our sever was outstanding! She was very thoughtful and made sure we were taken care of. I highly recommend coming and having a great time with your family.

We had a gift card to CPK, so we checked out this location. It's an actual sit-down place, not the quick eateries seen at some malls. We came late, around 8PM, and were seated right away. Waitstaff was helpful and friendly. The pizza was better than I remembered. Maybe because we were so hungry. The garlic chicken was back. It's topped with scallions, mozzarella, tiny chicken bits (very tiny). Crust had a nice bready flavor and chewiness. I liked it a lot. The chicken was dry and the pieces were, once again, very tiny. Overall flavor profile is extremely rich and savory, with a hint of smokiness. DH tried the creamy vodka fettuccine with red bell peppers. This one had a Southwest vibe. The pasta was thick, green, and texture was slightly off. Tough to describe, but it was sort of like eating day-old pasta. Which isn't bad, but isn't great either. Sauce was okay, though. We had the asparagus and arugula, shaved Parmesan salad, which was neatly plated. Really? At CPK? This was unexpected. It was a very nice blend, especially with the sun dried tomatoes. Portion size was a bit small, though. We'll probably be back. We still have $15 left on the gift card. Oh, and this place is kid-friendly too. Would be a nice change of pace for the parents out there.

I was very disappointed with the pizza I had last weekend.  I ordered a gluten free margarits pizza and it cost more money (20.00 for a small pizza and 2 drinks) and when I got the pizza there was hardly any sauce on it, it was burnt and very dry. For the price of the pizza, I thought there would be a better quality pizza.

Great food but service was a little too slow... Sometimes I don't mind waiting for my food especially if it's busy but there wasn't alot of people when I came in so I'm not sure why they couldn't get our order ready under 20 mins...we waited about 30 - 40 mins for our food.

Pretty good. I really like the pear and Gorgonzola pizza and I haven't tried really anything else on the menu since we rarely come here. The patio seating outside is nice. The last time I had been to CPK was the one upstairs at Stoneridge that was order at the counter. It's nice that they expanded it and have changed the menu quite a bit. They now offer thin crust, but can make any of their pizzas on regular crust. My pizza was about $13 and I'll get two meals out of it so not too bad. Our server seemed like she hated her job and didn't want to be there. It really bothers me when servers rush you to turn tables. I get you work off of tips but I like to enjoy my food and want to be able to eat for longer than 10 minutes before you come over and drop off the check and ask if I want a box. But I didn't let her crappy attitude rain on my parade. The food was yummy and we still had a good experience.

Just like every other CPK I've been too. Our waitress was horrible and had no task organization skills. Never checked on us and just assumed we were ok. Drinks were refilled once, only when we ask although my cup was empty immediately after receiving it. Good thing we were just visiting the area. Definitely not coming back to this location.

Had a quick lunch visit with my wife.  They rush you out, the food is fast, too fast to be quality.  And it was just bleh.  My wife liked her pizza, but I was not impressed with the food and frustrated being rushed.

California Pizza Kitchen is a perfect location to catch the over flow or the people who don't want wait at Cheesecake Factory right next door. I have not been to CPK for at least 15+ years. The Pleasanton location is located in the Stoneridge Mall. We ordered the following Spicy Chipotle Chicken Pizza  2/5 stars kinda weird cold on top with salsa hot crust Hummas 3/5 stars creamy served with warm pita wedges. Chicken Salad 3/5 stars lot's of greens not much chicken Guacamole with corn 3/5 stars great taste tiny portions with few chips  Service was good. Food came fast.

Two stars because the food was good but can't stand the customer service!!! If you need more workers then hire MORE WORKERS. My table was ignored the whole 2 hours we were here. It would have been a shorter dinner if the guy would have came to us! I got up several times to ask for things I needed. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone in a rush or with a short temper. Now the mall is closing and I have zero time to shop. I'm going back to Cheesecake Factory. California pizza belongs in L.A, where they know how to serve.

Gave this place another shot. Not to much of difference. Had the Mushroom, Sausage, Pepperoni pizza and my friend shared a Ceasar salad with me. Pizza is mediocre at best. Their lemonades are part of the refillable drinks, and that's good. Had the mango lemonade; a little too tart but the peach one was a little better.  Good atmosphere, good location around the outside of the mall near the back. Booths are huge LOL I love big booth and tables, space to spread out. Our server was really nice, one of the nicer ones I've experienced so that's why she got a good tip for even a small meal. Haha.

Came here for veterans day and received a complimentary pizza. To my surprise, it wasn't just a pizza the size of my hand but an actual pizza. I ordered the wild mushroom and it tasted pretty good and I enjoyed every bite. Service was good and kind to me. It did seem like they were having issues in the kitchen concerning where things needed to go and how fast people were getting their food. The manager did step up and take control of the situation and it seemed like everything started smoothing out again. As far as CPK pizza compared to other pizza's, it is high up on the list but I wouldn't put it in top 5.

I published my first blog post about California Pizza Kitchen's gluten-free items about three years ago when I first started blogging. It was right before they pulled their gluten-free pizza off the menu. CPK decided to start over and reintroduce their GF pizza..."the right way." While they kept certain GF items on the menu, they put the GF pizza on hold. They then approached the Gluten Intolerance Group of North America for a restaurant certification and made many changes to the process of making gluten-free pizza crust in their restaurants. Here are the important points to understand about CPK's gluten-free menu items including the new GF pizza. Important Points to understand about CPK's GF menu items 1) The Gluten Intolerance Group of North American (GIG) certifies restaurants that use the strict procedures approved by GIG. There are currently four "GIG certified" items on the CPK menu. They include the pizzas listed on the small menu above: GF Margherita, GF Chicken Barbecue, GF Mushroom Pepperoni Pizza and GF Pepperoni. 2) To be a "GIG certified" GF menu item at CPK, the food must be prepared in the new GF dedicated part of the kitchen and all of the ingredients used on the pizza must be from that dedicated area. For example, I requested goat cheese on my son's pizza since we don't do cow' milk cheese. They could not certify his pizza because the goat cheese comes from another part of the kitchen that is not certified. 3) You can order a different style pizza not listed on the above menu with the GF crust, but it will not be "GIG certified." 4) They use a blue sticker as seen below to seal all pizzas that are considered "certified." 5) The manager is supposed to deliver any certified GF pizza. It is to be delivered upon completion, even if it's done before the rest of the table's food so that it does not sit around and potentially become contaminated with flour/gluten. The manager is also supposed to wash his/her hands before handling the pizza. 6) There are other menu items listed as "GF" on their regular menu. These dishes are not considered "GIG certified." They are free of gluten ingredients but are not prepared in the dedicated part of the kitchen. The white corn guacamole and chips listed on the menu below is an example of this. This basically means that the dish is free of gluten ingredients but they cannot guarantee against cross contamination of gluten. I have inquired with CPK as to whether the chips are fried in dedicated oil but have not heard back yet. 7) CPK now uses rice flour to work all their pizza dough including wheat flour dough. This prevents the very small airborne flour molecules from contaminating the dedicated part of the kitchen. 8) I am told that the new CPK pizza dough is potato flour based. This Quinoa and Arugula Salad has been a long time favorite of mine. It has never made me sick. I also like the Roasted Veggie Salad but it has made me sick before. I'm not sure why. I have checked with CPK numerous times and they confirm each time that they use olive oil in their salad dressings. I believe that canola oil, commonly used in restaurants, causes a very similar reaction in my gut as gluten. Overall, I had a positive experience at CPK. I am waiting for answers to the following questions from CPK and will post their response here once I receive it. The answers are now posted below. 1)      Are all your salad dressing free of gluten ingredients? CPK: No, the only dressings that we consider to be Gluten Free are our Dijon Balsamic and Champagne Vinaigrette 2)      Are all your salad dressing made with olive oil and not canola oil? CPK: We use a combination of oils depending on the dressing. 3)      What is the flour blend used for your GF pizza crust? CPK: We use a combination of rice, potato and tapioca flour. 4)      Do you make your own crust or buy it pre-made? CPK: It's our custom recipe made for us at a GF California bakery. 5)      I assume your barbecue sauce is GF. What brand do you use? CPK: We use our own recipe. 6)      I noticed the quinoa and arugula salad is no longer marked GF. I thought it was before. I know it is not certified but is it free of gluten ingredients? If so, why is it no longer marked? CPK: It technically is, but since partnering with GIG, we agreed that we could not put "GF" on any menu items unless it was certified by them. We are currently working towards certification. 7)      Are there plans for a GF dessert? CPK: Not at this time. 8)      Do you offer any GF beers or hard cider? Someone told me they offer hard cider. CPK: We do! Our Crispin Honey Crisp Cider is Gluten Free. 9)      Are the chips of the White Corn Guacamole and Chips fried in dedicated oil? CPK: Yes. 10)   Are your GF pizzas baked in a separate oven? CPK: They are not, but they are baked following the strict guidelines set by GIG. This Restaurant Review earns a Coach Kim's Pick and a Sam's Pick.

I have visited this location many times, and my kids and family always enjoy the food and service. Today was exceptionally good. We had Nolan with a large group of kids, this am and he did such a good job. He was so patient and awesome with all of us. Our kids had a great time and loved all their food. Thanks Again!
Prompt service, friendly staffers, delicious food. Nice respite from the holiday shopping craze

I work close by so I decided to order from CPK for lunch. I got the chicken and shrimp pesto cream penne with sun dried tomatoes and added mushrooms. The pasta was a little dry, CPK didn't have enough pesto cream sauce in my pasta. Usually this pasta is very tasty and satisfying for me but this location failed me. Also, I paid extra to add mushrooms in my pasta and they barely gave me any mushrooms! WTH?!  Overall, because the pasta was lacking sauce it made the entire dish very plain. I didn't appreciate paying the extra money to receive almost no mushrooms in return. The service was nice and friendly though but the food was disappointing.
Our waitress tonight was extremely rude to us. Food was pretty good, but probably won't return because of the quality of our service.

A solid 3.5 star restaurant. As my second time coming to California Pizza Kitchen, I think their service has greatly improved. Out waitress was extremely friendly and immediately came to take our order for drinks after we were seated. After we received our drinks, she took our main dish orders and everything ran very smoothly. Last time we weren't given any appetizers for free. However, after we ordered our meals, our waitress came by with complimentary bread and olive oil. You could ask for more free bread if you wanted, which was nice of them. We ordered 4 pizzas, a salad, and a half/half soup. The salad and soup were mediocre, nothing special really. CPK's pizzas are different from the typical pizza company because their crusts/breads are less oily, and you can tell that they made them from scratch. Each pizza is about $12-14 and serves 1-2 people. I think prices are okay, not very cheap and not over the top expensive.  CPK is a pretty decent chain restaurant. I would come here again if I was in the area.

I didn't know it took 30 minutes to make a Caesar salad. I didn't know you have to act like there's nothing weird about laying some wilted lettuce on a plate. I also didn't know you're supposed to never ask how your meal is or if you want another drink or ask if you want to pay your bill 45 minutes after you finished your food. I just didn't know!
It took 45 mins to get a salad.. When it came out the lettuce was wilted.. Then it took another 40mins to get the check. Horrible service.

I would like to share my bad experience at this place. We went here for dinner tonight and it was very disappointed that  we were told they ran out of sausage when we wanted to order a mushroom and sausage pizza on their menu. How can they allow a pizza business run out of sausage?? LOL.. Now i can see why their reviews are bad. I won't recommend this place to my friends and co-workers.

We came here for a late Saturday lunch to avoid the mass of people waiting at the Cheesecake Factory. Luckily there were a few spots left at the bar which was open seating, so we swooped in and got to ordering. I had my usual at CPK, the California Club pizza, but this time switched it up and tried the crispy thin crust. My friend had the Thai Chicken pizza. The Cali Club at this location was actually a lot larger than it is when I usually order it, but had a smaller salad topping on top. The crispy thin crust was slightly charred on the edge, but overall the pizza was still pretty filling but I just wish it had more chicken pieces on top. Definitely needed a to-go box after eating half of it. The Thai Chicken pizza was also a good choice, and came topped with shredded carrots, bean sprouts, and green onions. And don't forget the drinks! The appleberry sangria was delicious and fruity with pieces of peaches and blueberries mixed in. Unfortunately the mango mango mojito this time was a bit watered down and tasted more like just Sprite instead of mango. Lastly, since the CPK app wasn't letting us get the free small plate of white corn guacamole, the waitress was kind enough to give us dessert on the house. We shared the new dessert option on the menu which was the salted caramel pudding with an oreo crust. The pudding itself was alright, but they topped it with way too much sea salt. More like extra salty caramel pudding!

I like CPK at other locations but went to this one since we were shopping at the mall. I never had a pizza this bad.  we ordered the work and when it came out, there is not sausage, no cheese, no sauce and only a few very thinly sliced pepperone.  Told the waitress and the manager came over to explain that they ran out of sausage!!  Why they did not tell us???  The manager and the pizza cook should be fired.

I really do like this place. I've been here a handful of times, one of which was on Veteran's Day when they gave out a free pizza to any veteran who came in (my boyfriend, an army veteran, got the wild mushroom).  I've never had a bad pizza here, and the service had always been nice, though they can get rather busy. I also like how ready to customize things they are. I always get the thin crust regardless of what pizza I order.  For my latest visit, I took my mother here for lunch. It was a Sunday afternoon, and at the mall it was understandably quite busy. However, our server made us feel very welcome and we were well looked after; you could see him constantly running around checking on people and bringing food out to do this for all of his tables.  We got the wild mushroom pizza on the thin crust, and it came out just lovely as always. My mother and I managed to finish the entire thing between ourselves, although we were quite stuffed afterwards. It was just too good to stop eating!
The food is always good.  I especially like the tortilla corn soup.  My favorite dish is the chicken Milanese.  Excellent service.

20 minutes late for multiple to go orders on several different occasions. Very disappointing. I spend a lot of money on lunch catering & they are consistently late every time!!!  It's too bad because I really like their food & online ordering

My family and I come here semi-regularly. The food is pretty consistently good, but some of it is prepped ahead of time, such as the salads, so ingredients such as onions cannot be removed. The staff is generally friendly and attentive, and if you're from the area, you probably know a few of the staff already.

Awesome place to stop by after a long day of shopping! I can always rely on this place when it's late at night. California Pizza Kitchen is such a nice change from going to Cheesecake Factory! Both are open late but CPK is just so fresh and the atmosphere is so warm and inviting. Parking lot in front of this restaurant is ALWAYS packed! I always do end up finding a spot though which is good. Typically I have to wait about 15-20 minutes to be seated. The hostess is always so welcoming! As soon as I am seated I am able to order my drink while I search and see what food I want to order for that visit. No matter how long I search, no doubt about it, I'll always get the Chicken Artichoke pizza and the Gargonzola and Pear. Chicken Artichoke has an awesome savory flavor and I love the contrast that I get when I order the sweet Pear and Gorgonzola.  Service varies but for the most part, my service is always extremely helpful and nice. I can always expect to get my check I a timely manner along with a box for whatever is left of my pizza. Love this location and will for sure be stopping by soon!
Good food. Good service.  Had the Cesar salad and Margarita pizza.  I really like their Cesar dressing, not too strong but still tasty.

I love CPK, but your service was horrible. Our waitress, Renee, was so rude and very slow with orders. We've had her serve our table a couple times before and each time seems to be disappointing. My family's dining experience was ruined during our last visit by this server's attitude. Great food, but please hire more appropriate employees to satisfy your customers. I'd rather not have her as our waitress again.
One of the best restaurants in Pleasanton. We go here regularly and always have been more than satisfied.

We had problem with our waiter and we refused to order from him. I asked hostess for different waiter. Manager came but we saw him going to wrong tables. Then finally came to us and apologize. He didn't even offer free appetizer or soft drinks. I do not recommend this restaurant when other locations actually want our business.
Yuck...their pizza is the worst out there.  Little Ceasars is a lot better and cheaper.
the original bbq chicken chopped salad is sooooo yum

My first time at this restaurant and while I would have never picked this place I was pleasantly surprised.  We had the caramelized peach salad and the Kung pao spaghetti with shrimp. Both were delicious. The waitress had no smile and actually appeared annoyed all night but the manager did his rounds and was a nice touch.  I would add this as a place to go

one of my friends told me about this place and their BBQ salad so I went there twice. since i wasn't familiar with the place first time I ordered the  salad to go. second time again I ordered the BBQ salad but this time I told to the cashier I want to eat inside the restaurant but she gave me my order in to go pack . Since i had no idea there is a service fee I went to outdoor place and started to eat my salad because I was in rush didn't have time to ask her change the pack. I just started to eat my food' the manager came out and in front of bunch of people who were there told me you have not sit here because you have to pay fee. I explained for him that I told your cashier and it was her mistake and this is not big deal and I can pay the fee right now but he wanted to show that he is so generous in front of every body and told me this time is ok but from next time. I never been so down in my life for the little money. he was so rude and impolite. at the time I felt so nervous and left the place right away. If this was their rule I really appreciated him If let me to finish my dish and then tell me in private not in front of bunch of people . every thing is not about the food the most important thing for this kind of place is how you deal and communicate with your costumer. Although I had plan to bring my family there I never ever go to this place that their manager doesn't know even the basic of costumer service .
I had a half-California Club half-Wild Mushroom pizza topped with white truffle oil and it was just delicious! Service is fast and waiters are friendly.

this location has to be the WORST CPK I've ever had. Our server was nice, but I don't know if they were short staffed, it was not busy at all. the waitress took our order, bread showed up I swear 20mins after we were seated. Next we had dirty/smelly plates, from the bread plates, to my salad plate. Mine smelled so bad I couldn't enjoy my food. We also had to remind the waitress for our drink. so sad

The asparagus arugula salad with quinoa and chicken was absolutely delicious!! The bread is now served warm with dipping oil (as opposed to their signature cold with butter).  CPK, I love the reinvention of yourselves!!! Keep up the good work--I will be back for more!!

I am not sure why this place didn't get that many stars. My husband and I LOVE CPK! We never ate at one before moving to California and I am not sure why. We have been there twice in the last month and weren't disappointed either time. The biggest thing that set me apart for them is their menu options. I am vegan and it is really hard to go out to eat. Once seeing their menu online, I knew it was worth a shot.  The first meal we sat outside. Now I know it was not their fault but the outside did smell like sewage. It's not their fault for sure, but it still didn't make for the most appetizing meal. I had the camelized peach salad and at first it came out with the cheese. Our waiter was very apologetic and brought me a new one shortly after. I also had the salsa appetizer. Both were good. The food was great, the service was great. The second meal was just as good and we sat indoors (no sewage smell). The wait staff was just as friendly and the manager is superb. We thoroughly enjoyed our food and will continue to come to CPK often.

I came here yesterday with my mother and I ordered Mac & cheese with bacon. I usually ask for the oil with the little leaves that come out with the bread so I can pour it into my food & I add in pepper too. It is delicious. Mac & cheese is not on the menu but they do have it. Our server was wonderful! Kept checking up on us, very polite. His name on his name tag was Izzy but on the receipt it was Israel. I def recommend him to be your server.
Pizza was OK. They didn't serve the bread. Mojito wasn't that great. Service was horrible.

My boyfriend and I came here for the third time and I must say, everything is very mediocre and bleh.  Service: our waitress was friendly but we only saw her maybe three times during our whole meal. She took our order and left. Another server came by with our food. No one came by to check on us or how the food was.  Food:  My boyfriend always get the bolognese spaghetti and it is always DRY. Yeah there's a light and even coat of sauce on the pasta but it would be nice if there was a tad bit more sauce. (11.99? Around there) I'm a huge fan of Tomatina's spaghettini so I decided to try CPK's. I got the fresh spinach and asparagus spaghettini with the checca sauce.  For those of you who don't know, checca sauce is an uncooked tomato sauce used with pasta. I didn't know that so I did google it before I ordered. Google images sure made it look delicious! I was feeling hungry so I ordered grilled chicken (extra $4) with it as well.  When the food got here, it was a pretty good portion. Unfortunately the pasta was very dry. Pretty much it was just bits of spinach, tomato and small pieces of asparagus tossed together on top of the pasta. No real sauce, everything was tossed together with olive oil (I'm pretty sure) and maybe some herbs. Is that how checca sauce is?! I was disappointed cause I like my spaghettini with a sauce. The grilled chicken was alright.  Wasn't worth $4 though. I ate everything since this dish was $16 -___-  TIP: if you get any of their pastas and you're a sauce lover like me, let them know you want extra sauce! Or else you'll be left with some pretty dry spaghetti that you need water to chase down your throat.  Oh yeah, try Tomatina's spaghetti!! That is 100x better!

My all time favorite pizza joint! I absolutely love the chipotle chicken pizza. Although I've been ordering the same dish for many years, I've tried quite a few of their other unique pizza options. Their pesto pasta is also pretty good. This place is a great option to eat lunch/dinner at after an eventful shopping trip!
Terrible service with unprofessional staff and the food is not like other locations which is what I expected from a chain. I will not be returning to this location.

I loooooooove california pizza kitchen. I have this location's phone number saved in my favourites since I call to order curbside so often. Usually when I order over the phone (I always get the pear and gorgonzola pizza with extra hazelnuts) it's ready within 5-15 minutes to pick up curbside depending on the time/day. Each time I've had lunch/dinner inside the restaurant the servers are always extremely polite and have good dish recommendations. The hummus with traditional pita bread is great. The pasta is always dry so you should definitely ask for extra sauce. Overall, I can't think of a single thing wrong with any of my experiences at CPK at stoneridge. 5/5.

Even thought this is a chain I have to give them credit for having one of my favorite salads.  If you're into salad and haven't tried the ones here at California Pizza Kitchen you're really missing out.  My favorite is the Moroccan-Spiced Chicken Roasted butternut squash, dates, avocado, toasted almonds, beets, red peppers, chopped egg and cranberries. Tossed with house made Champagne vinaigrette. They are very comfortable with any adjustments to additions or removing items (I don't like the eggs or avocado) and have never given me any troubles with my requests. Even a different dressing(I like the balsamic vinaigrette)  I came in for an early dinner last night and had the place to myself. The service was top notch. I took a drink of water and had it getting refilled almost before I put my glass down.  My friend had their egg roles and I have to admit they looked wonderful.  Don't be fooled with their name. They do have much more in their pocket besides Pizza.

So I ordered for curbside pick up.. 1. Their are cars parked in the curbside doors with no one inside and this establishment doesn't give 2 sh*ts 2. I'm parked right in front for over 20 minutes now trying to pick up an order that was supposed to be ready over 20 minutes ago. 3. Do I need a 3?

This is a decent California Pizza Kitchen located in the Great Mall. I was not feeling super hungry so I got a salad.  Their caramelized peach salad was surprisingly delicious (although feta cheese is a bit too strong for me so I would have left it off).  Their half size portion sounded really small even for me so I opted to get the full size for about $13. Also, something about their water cups and ice makes the water taste really good.  Not sure why. Service is okay if a little bit lacking but otherwise it was fine.

Great for families and kids parties.  Food is fine and prices a bargain.  Has at kids parties here several times and with them for after sports lunches.  They are very accommodating to families.  Not a place for a date in my view.  Not my regular type of place - but great for kids and kids parties, they are very accommodating if you need that on occasion ?  Else, I like the salads if I'm there occasionally.
Small portions, the restaurant has a weird stinky smell... Service isnt great.. Much prefer cheesecake factory over this.. Did not have a good time dining here :(

Gluten free pizza crust feels like cardboard, tastes like it too. It didn't help that the pizza was cold when brought  to the table.  Staff was a bit over bearing. The experience was bad enough that I don't want to give them another chance (I used to love CPK when I lived in LA....)
Always come here every sunday for Original BBQ Chicken Salad , Spicy Chipotle Pizza , Drinks. Always tastes so good!! Satisfied our carving especially the salad lol. Enjoy.

Love this family restaurant! Best salads!! Great pasta and absolutely love the butter cake with ice cream. My kids shared the fettuccine with Parmesan garlic cream sauce. It's always a nice place to dine!

I came here with a friend after a long day of shopping.  We both ordered half a salad (I ordered Thai crunch), and two appetizers (Avocado club roll, and Shrimp lettuce wrap). We could only finish the appetizers but not the salad. The portion size are huge! Service was okay. What you expect at a chain restaurant

My friend and I go here for the pastas! Garlic Cream and Chicken Tequila! The five stars goes especially to our waitress, Juliet. She was very nice and friendly. She always checked on us and was always on time with our complimentary refills of lemonade. She even knew that I wanted my pasta to go without even having to ask and packed it for me. My friend and I will look for her when we come back here!

Went here yesterday for the first time... I should have took the hint for the place was pretty empty.  I thought it was just timing.  I came with my 1 year old and I ordered 2 appetizers and a child's pizza.  I ordered the avocado egg rolls and spinach dip- which are usually safe bets at most restaurants.   The avocado egg rolls came with one piece of avocado per roll- and were slimy.  I also missed the part in the menu where they're chicken eggrolls- that's all they were.  I took one bite- they were slimy.  And not good.  The spinach dip came luke warm- also had a slimy- not very fresh- glaze on top.. I ate a little for I was hungry--- but mostly ate my child's pizza.    So- only order pizza.  Otherwise yucky.  Service was decent.

Needed to return something at the mall, so I decided to have lunch here also. Never been to California Pizza Kitchen, pizza is good for breakfast, lunch, and dinner so why not right?  I walked in and was immediately greeted by a gentleman at the front desk, who I believe was the manager. Him and the girl in front were really nice and welcoming, the waitress greeted my son and as she walked us to our seats she made him feel more comfortable. He is a shy kid. Once we got seated our waitress came to our table shortly after with water and menus. I really thought about getting a pasta, because they all seemed so good. I decided to go with the BBQ chicken pizza since I did come here for pizza. Next time I'll definitely try one of the pastas. The pizza came out no more than 10 minutes later. It was amazing. The pizza was topped with cilantro, BBQ sauce, chicken and red onions. If I knew it was going to be that good I would've ordered one more. The pizza itself was nice and crispy. The crust was perfect, soft on the inside and crunchy on the outside. My son also loved it, he couldn't stop saying 'papa I like pizza' lol. The next time I come I'll be sure to ask for more chicken on the pizza, I like my pizza with meat on each bite.  5 stars for the excellent and attentive service and great pizza. Will definitely be back soon.

The pizza was great. I ordered online and went to pick it up. it was hot and ready by the time I got there. The salad was great, but the hawaiian pizza was delish! I haven't really eaten a lot of cpk pizza but the hawaiian and cheese. But I'm a huge fan of the crust and size of pineapple!
Always good. Good service. Great good. Even better with lovely company.  My fav order is Pesto cream penne with chicken and extra sauce :)
I did like the spaggetti with esparragus even if im not a vegetables lover.  service was really nice and fast ,  it was a bussy day, and I did not feel in a rush to finish and go.

Three of us arrived at CPK for dinner.  The host took down our name and told us it would be a 20 minute wait.  We headed into the mall so my friend could get money from the ATM.  She considered strolling around the mall for a while, but thankfully we headed back to the CPK. The moment we walked in, they called our party.  Only 15 minutes!  I really like it when the wait is shorter than they say it will be.  Our server took the drink orders, and patiently gave us a few more minutes to look over the menu.  One of my friends had never eaten at CPK before. I ordered the Thai chicken pizza.  The server said the bread would take a few more moments, but then she would bring it right out.  However, the pizzas arrived first.  She still brought out the hot bread and olive oil dip anyway.  It was very good, and we ate it along with our pizza.  The pizza was excellent, just like I remember.  The only way it could be improved is if the crust were baked crunchy on the bottom. Service was attentive without being obtrusive.  Even though they were really busy, it was clear our server was handing a reasonable amount of tables and not covering half the restaurant.

Went there last Friday, the place was very crowded, but the pizza came fast and the food was hot, we were happy with the food, nothing remarkable regarding the service, so 2 days later, when we went shopping at the mall, I suggested my families to eat there again. Well, big mistake! There was only about 5 tables of customers, the food take forever to arrived, when it finally came, one of the waitress throw the plates onto our table from midair then walked away, leaving us completely shocked; all three pizza was lukewarm and one of them was missing the sauce; like that's not bad enough, half way through eating (that's 10 minutes after we got the food), our waitress came and ask if we wanted to box up the food, we were like, WHAT??? The restaurant was empty and there are rushing the customer away? The whole time we were there, the waitress who throw the plates onto our table, was acting very unprofessionally, she was either sitting with her friends at the table near the front door, picking at their food, eating or taking loudly, completely disregard that there are customer in the restaurant. This is a place I will never go back to, ever.

We were seated right away, this was good seeing as I was so hungry.  Ordered the fish tacos. Delish. Fresh slaw in the tacos with the texture of the Panko crusted fish was very tasty. The chips were crispy and the salsa had good bite. That's will be ordered again for sure.  Hubby loved the salad and the soup was hearty and flavorful.  My son had zero complaints about his sandwich!  Good job.

I truly enjoyed California Pizza Kitchen tonight. My GF Ilana and her little son picked me up for dinner and some hangout time.  "Where should we go?" I asked.  Ilana told me about CPK--we can eat and shop at the mall...nice! We piled into her car and drove out to the Pleasanton area.  The mall was pretty crowded but we found great parking and all went inside.  The hostess "kind of" greeted us, it was odd (mind you this is the only reason this location looses any stars) and asked if we needed seating.  Yep... We were seated at a comfortable table where my walking accoutrements (I recently had foot surgery) were out of the way of both patrons and employees.  As Ilana and I were discussing how weird the hostess made us feel our server, Izzy, greeted us with a warm smile and a friendly attitude--wow...we just forgot the rude hostess! Izzy offered us drinks and menu suggestions while leaving us with bread and olive oil to start.  We went with his recommendation of Avocado Egg Rolls and also added the White Corn Guacamole.  Both items came out in a timely fashion, hot and were tasty. Ilana's son was really hungry, bordering on "hangry" (you know--hungry mixed with angry) so she ordered him a tiny pepperoni pizza and some apple juice to calm his tiny tummy. I ordered the thin crust artichoke and spinach pizza, and had NO IDEA how BIG it was.  What will I do with all the left overs?  Ilana ordered the Chicken Milense with panko crust, arugula and thick Parmesan shavings.  Hers looked better than mine ;( but mine tasted superb.  The three of us shared everything as we chopped it up and enjoyed each other's company. The manager, Tony, came and checked on us as he was walking throughout the establishment talking with guests and helping his staff.  He chatted with us for several minutes about the business, service, the mall, etc.  We really enjoyed Tony's managerial style and genuine concern for the guests.  Tony made us feel welcome and appreciated.   Between Izzy's excellent service and Tony's sincere and respectful managing, we almost forgot about the "cold" hostess at the entrance.  I will say, she is the only reason I deducted a star, too bad for CPK.  The hostess should be the friendliest employee in the restaurant, I think. Our food was prompt, hot and delicious.  Our server, Izzy, was helpful and courteous.  Tony, the manager, was concerned and friendly.  We will return to this CPK for these reasons, and hopefully the attitudes of both the server and manager will be contagious for the hostess ;)  Stephani Smiles for CPK ;)

I visited this location because the Cheesecake factory had a 30 minute wait. Little did I know, I would wait thirty minutes for my order to be taken (after being seated). While there was a problematic table in our section, the floor staff seemed unwilling to help each other during stressful moments. Our server then vented to us about a rude guest and blamed the wait on their special allergy requirements. The food was otherwise good, but the draft beer list needs to grow. I really don't want a 32-ounce bottled beer with dinner.

Friendly service and good food. Ordered the Hawaiian bbq chicken pizza and half a Thai crunch salad. The pizza was hot and tasty. Although I can never finish a full pizza, so filling. The Thai crunch salad was divine! My only concern is that there was a chunk of edamame that was still frozen and for that I took off a star. The bread they give you while you're waiting for your food was warm and fluffy :) I had the peach iced tea to drink, it was alright but I think I'll pass next time. My boyfriend ordered a coke but it tasted like diet... Other than that, great place to take a break from shopping and eat! I'll definitely be back

This is the second time my husband and I attempted to dine at CPK in the Stoneridge Mall, unfortunately both times were bad experiences. The first time our server was horrible. The second time the manager had us sit at the table by the front door, it was extremely loud, and people kept pushing my chair. We asked our very nice server to have us moved. The manager snapped at him and said, "No, no. Not right now!" There were two other tables we could have been moved to. The chunky manager was rude and didn't not even care to know why we wanted to be moved. All in all, horrible place. Will not be returning.

Terrible service!!! The reason I'm giving one is because food was decent. We only saw our server three times since we've here, few times we had to call other servers for stuff. When asked for bread our server bought all the end parts from the bin. Not coming back here again.

2 stars just because of service, the food was great!  Got to this location and sat down, the server Rosie, came over didn't suggest anything simply asked what we would like to drink then told us to take our time, when she came back she asked if we were ready and when I asked a question seemed a little upset about it. We ordered, we received our food from the food runners and didn't see our server until we were FINISHED with our meal, I had to flag another server down for drink refills while we were eating too. My dad was still snacking on the chips and salsa and with his mouth full she asked if she could bring the check... We definitely felt rushed. To make matters worse we sat with dirty appetizer plates on the table while we ate our entree... Be warned.

We got an eventful night last night! Too eventful for my first time going to California Pizza Kitchen.  1 star for the way under performance service! Food was good. The server gave me a bottle of hot sauce and upon using it, the bottom of the bottle broke. The whole bottle of hot sauce was on my pants, all over my coat, cover my thighs and it was a mess. And it burned! The bottle suddenly broke so I wouldn't blame them for it. But it was at THEIR WRONG because they handed us an unsafe (later broken) supply and it happened within their restaurant, within their overseeing and control! Then came the servers tried to say sorry and clean up that mess. They were confused and seemed like don't know what to do. Then came the manager. She asked for my number and said that I could bring the dry clean receipt back, it would be reimbursed. She didn't even ask if I was ok; didn't even think about taking initiative to learn if there was anything they can assist to make me feel better and to correct this situation. All she did was to show us she was sorry, and she clearly showed that her "would be reimbursement" on my dry clean was enough or might be too big of a compensate for the big hot mess on my dining out. We were really upset and were ready to leave the place, but managed to chill the night for we knew things happened. And we thought the restaurant would know what to do better in SATISFYING their customers. While we are busy cleaning up on our part, the food went cold. There's no offer to re-do our dinner or even to warm the plates up for us. And we didn't see any server come again to our table until we were ready to pay. It was a Wednesday night, and it was not busy! Then came the check and the manager again, saying sorry again and still no REALISTIC ACTIONS on their part. Then my friend asked her was that it for correcting their incident in their place? She said let her think about it and came back with a so big "$15 gift card". How bad I wanted to show her how to be a real deal manger! I write this complaint for I want to tell California Pizza Kitchen at Stoneridge Mall that there will be many times unexpected things like last night happened; and no matter what, you should stay true to your plead to SATISFY your customer, not trying to get away by quick fix and low expectation that you will only do what you think is an enough compensation on your part. To the manager, your way of taking care of these things should be more professional and more caring on your part. Don't just say sorry and do nothing. You could be a better manager when you ACT your APOLOGY realistically. The restaurant can thrive if you lead your team giving an extraordinary service and experience to customers than what you gave last night. I paid $58.42 to get 2 cold pizzas, a throw away pants & shirt with hot sauce spill, a stink coat, wet shoes, dirty purse and and burned thighs! Your really bad service and $15 gift card would never come close to meet anyone's acceptance, don't even think about satisfaction.  Totally an unpleasant experience at this restaurant!

Super slow service even when there's barely any people in the restaurant..  Kids fruit cup had grapes and pineapples and they were all super bad. The fruits has rotted and they still served it.. My kids didn't even touch it and they LOVE grapes.  The sandwhich bread on chibatta bun was super hard and not eatable..  I can't believe they serve food here. Taking my money elsewhere next time  Pizza is okay but not worth the price
Love the pizza, always a favorite. BBQ chicken pizza is the    Will needs to cool his jets a little bit.

4.5 stars  CPK is truly a wonderful family restaurant! I have been here many times and the food is usually pretty good.  This time, I ordered the deep fried macaroni bites and dumplings to start. The macaroni bites were very tasty and the perfect texture. As for the dumplings... They were sort of gross... The meat inside tasted horrible and the sauce on them was really unpleasant. Definitely DO NOT order!  For my entrée, I had the carnitas tacos.... pretty tasty! The chips and salsa that came with them were surprisingly good. Though everything on the plate was a little spicy, their great iced tea cooled my mouth.  As for my dessert, I had the pudding. I was satisfied with it, but I didn't like the saltiness in the pudding.... Not as sweet as I thought it would be.... :(  SERVICE WAS WONDERFUL! Thank you Lindsay for being so attentive and coping with my difficult family!!

Had a 'layover' from the Apple Store and hadn't eaten. Didn't want P.F. Changs or Cheesecake Factory; we had both of these in Cincinnati. Was thinking of heading to Buckhorn Grill, but saw California Pizza Kitchen and decided it was at CPK we would eat. We sat outside and even though the parking lot was just over the 'hedge', the view of the green hills in the distance was very pleasant.  Out waitress was so friendly and attentive. We opted to split a hand-tossed pizza with 1/2 wild mushroom and 1/2 pepperoni. We both got white truffle oil.  The pizza was good and splitting one made for a reasonably priced lunch.  I'd give the pizza a three, the service a five and the view a three - that's close enough to a four for me.

Don't do curbside pick up on a weekend! Called in a small order (1 pizza and 1 salad) and got a pick up time of 6:09. Arrived at 6:15 (allowing them some extra time to get order ready) and called curbside pick up number. Waited about 25 minutes and called again to see if I should wait or just come in for my order. Was told my order would be right out. 10 minutes later and I'm still waiting as I write this review. Terrible service! If you are going to offer this type of service please make sure you can follow up and actually deliver it! This is the worst.

My complaint is against the guy working as a Host. I was standing in a line at the host table, courteously waiting for my turn to reserve a table. He conveniently started talking to a guy behind me and jotted his name down. I pointed this out but he still seated that party before us and then unceremoniously dumped us at a "shaded" table outside on a pretty hot day without giving us a seating preference. When we asked to be seated inside, he said "get back on the waiting list".  This was our first poor experience at any CKP. We just walked out of the place. I hate doing this but I simply cannot tolerate racism. Oh.. And did I mention that my name "sounds" muslim?

My BFF and I planned a last minute shopping trip on a holiday and didn't make plans for lunch.  We stopped by CPK around 1-ish in the afternoon.  There were a lot of people waiting inside and outside but we were seated fairly quickly, within 15 minutes.   Our server was pleasant and made a few menu suggestions.  Good recommendations I might add.   Often times when restaurants are busy, compounded with the holidays, I wonder how service will turn out.  In this case, I was very pleased with the whole experience of our visit, from service to food selections and wait time.  I would return the this CPK location again.

Soooo, first time here. Even if they did have CPKs in WA. I just never found my way in. Went here on a Friday, around lunchtime so they were lightweight slammed. But for a party of 7, they seated us within 10 mins, which isn't bad. They have a different place in the back corner of the restaurant near the kitchen where you pick up online/called in orders, FYI. It doesn't look that big from the outside but inside could easily seat a good amount of people. Pretty much all the tables were filled. The kitchen is open so you can see the chefs making your food, & they actually have seating right there. It has the best seat for watching sports since the TV is right there. Our waitress was friendly but took a while to get our order & then our order took almost 30-35 mins to arrive. For people on a lunchtime crunch, we were a little impatient. (She asked what we were there for & we told her it was a work lunch for a co-workers birthday, so she knew it was lunchtime for us) I ordered the Pesto Cream Penne, which is a freshly made basil pesto cream sauce with sun dried tomatoes and parmesan. Let me tell you, they are not sheisty on the sauce. They drench that bad boy, lol. I am just sayin'. Nothing is worse than dry noodles, right?! There were some sauce leftover & I had a good amount of noodles drowning in it. I am a fan! :) The pasta was yummers!!! The sun-dried tomatoes were on point with this dish, the perfect combination. Other than the long wait for the food, it was good :) I know, I went to CPK & didn't try their pizza, shame shame but there's always next time!
I can't believe people had bad reviews about this restaurant. Pizza is the best you can ever have. I love it here. Also the staff here are friendly and helpful. I really recommend this place

This is my second time coming to CPK and I finally ordered pizza, ahaha. I honestly didn't like it that much. I ordered the four cheeses pizza, it wasn't the best. We came during the day, so we were seated quickly. However, my cousin did get her food until the rest of us were done with most of our meals. The hostess was friendly. But I think our waiter was new, because he seemed to be awkward and not knowing what he was doing. He really struggled at the end, in regards to splitting the check with different cards. But, I cut him some slack because it's not easy bring a waiter. I just hope he keeps practicing. Unfortunately, I think I am going to lay off visiting CPKs for awhile, I have yet to have a great experience.

At California Kitchen restaurant. Small cheese pizza is good but they mess up on my salad. The manager was nice to fix it the order. Rosie is the best waiter there .. I would have to say the only reason why ur order got messed Mr.S is because u orders it wrong!

I think that other pizza parlors have a better selection than this spot!   I tried the favorite pizza there and I was kind of disappointed!  It seems like everything was thin and the flavor was bland.   The wait was really long...I think I would rather be happy somewhere else,

My friend and I came here for a late lunch and we were really underwhelmed. I ordered one of the small bites fennel sausage & poblano peppers pizzas and she ordered a sandwich. My pizza was extremely dry and they put so many poblano peppers on it it was practically a salad... It had MAYBE 5 pieces of sausage on the whole thing and did I mention it was D-R-Y? The store-bought CPK pizzas in the frozen section are better than this tasted... My friend's sandwich was also disappointing. Not much flavor and too much bread. The small shining redemption was the strawberry shortcake dessert. It was pretty good.  Also, it was SUPER awkward when literally as soon as we finished signing the check, our waitress swooped in, opened the book, paused to see what we tipped her, and then took it away. Can't you wait until we leave?? I literally had just put the pen down. Rather rude and uncomfortable. It was shame because she was a good server up until that point... it totally ruined the experience for me after that. Way to leave a good impression... Had the other restaurants next door not been super busy we would not have come here... next time I will wait the 20 minutes for better food.
