Had the most horrible experience today at your California Pizza Kitchen at Stoneridge Mall​.  It was my birthday and I was there with my kids.  The manager of the restaurant knew because my 6 year old daughter was so excited she told him when we arrived.  My meal was fine and my waiter was great.  The issue is with the other wait staff at the restaurant, as well as the manager.  Several times there were people in wheel chairs that had to get pushed to a table and they had to get through the area that I was in.  Both times the servers pushing the individuals in the wheel chair asked me (while I was eating) if I could push my chair in closer so that they could get through.  This would not have irritated me so much except that I  noticed both times that on the other side of the hall, there was a man at a table, not eating, who had his chair pushed unreasonably far out from the table.  It would make sense to ask this person to move their chair because a) they had their chair unreasonably far out b) the person was not eating.  I don't know if they didn't want to ask the other person because he was a man and I was a female, but either way he was the one that should have been asked to move.  I raised this concern to the manager and he kept saying it wasn't a big deal and it's unreasonable to expect his 16 year old servers to know that they should have asked the man instead.  WTF.  Seriously.  Aren't you the restaurant manager and why would you hire 16 year old severs  that have no idea about common sense and courtesy?  The restaurant manager never said he was sorry, nor did he ever say he would educate his staff better- he kept giving me rude looks like I was crazy for complaining.  We would never have gone here for my birthday except that I had a very busy work day and the kids were too hungry to drive further.  Well, I have learned my lesson.  This CPK location has a lousy rude manager, who never said sorry and never offered me anything for the inconvenience, and clearly hires impolite servers.  Oh, and it was also painfully clear that he likes to hire young female servers, there were very few older older servers.  I had an older male server and he was actually very good.  Perhaps hire some more courteous and experienced servers over your young impolite and inexperienced 16 year old servers, and don't belittle customers and their feelings especially when it is their birthday.

very good pizza and pasta while i was here. they have this super duper kids party package where you can bring your kids and their friends to create their own pizza. it was super adores. What a great idea!
Ok for a quick meal, but not something that you'd crave or really want to go back to.  Just a quick stop for mostly edible food while you have other things to do.

The Pizza from CPK are simply Delicious. I had the "Five Cheese Pizza" last time I went there, and I just loved it. The Service we received was really good. And in small words, the Meal was worth every cent. So, If you like the Italian Cuisine, and especially Pizzas, then this is the Place to Go. Highly Recommended.

Though it was a nice day out the hostess would not seat me outside which was the reason I went to this location. The hostess and waitress were nice but it's hard to sit in a very dark room while it was nice out. Bummer. The BBQ chicken chopped salad made up for it though! The half salad was the perfect portion and it was put together so well each bite had a little bit of everything. Kiddos to the chefs/cooks. Served fast on my lunch hour which was greatly appreciated.

We had lunch today and the service was the worst! We were patiently waiting for our bread after we ordered. Until we saw our server gave the bread to another party sat down 10 mins after us. Then, the bread came after our food arrived. While we were still eating, the server not even asked if we need anything and just drop the check at our table. Food not impress! I would rather to go Cheesecake Factory or Buckhorn Grill next time!

Today I went to California Pizza Kitchen (CPK) and it was my first time coming here and I have to say the staff are very polite. A member of the staff Casandra ( sorry if I misspelled your name) helped me take care of our order . Also another staff helped me by showing the way to the take out booth. I thinks pretty neat how there's a take out both not much restraints have that.Now for the pizza. It was very tasty exept for the amount of grease on the pizza.   Suggestions  - Limit the amount of grease on the food

California Pizza Kitchen is officially my favorite restaurant. I've been here several times throughout the years and the food and service never fail to disappoint me. During my most recent visit, we had a very sweet waitress that was efficient and got our food out in no time. Everything from  the complementary bread and oil to the barbecue chicken pizza was delicious. I really wish they would start doing take-out so I could order pizza from here more often. I'd recommend this to anyone look for a fun family dinner or lunch outing!

We love CPK!!! But this time couple of person ruin it for us. We are trying to get a patio table for 8, for some reason they said they don't do more than 8-9 people outside but what Piss me off is that there's a family of 8 outside eating  so I was shocked that she said that so that triggers me something already, secondly we have a tiny dog and we ask if we could bring her outside (this is why we want to seat outside anyway, coz we know the rules) they said they only allow service dog which I understand. But the way she look at us and said it is really the annoying part until now I could still see her face. They don't have a good costumer service and they don't know how to explain things well. I talk to the manager about us not able to get a seat outside because there's 8 of us and he said that they do seat party of 8 or more all the time and he said he's pretty sure that she probably doesn't know  For me I hope this is a lesson to her. I wish her luck with her career.

Things are just aren't the same anymore......... We ordered the spaghetti bolognese, didn't have enough sauce on it, I asked for more and they said it would be a charge, I said ok of course.....that was 16 buck dish.....not worth it What we did like was the works pizza.....comes with all and we order the same dishes all the time..... When we brought out the leftovers, yes, cause we had a big lunch, I came back to work and found a roach in the bag, but I can't blame it on CPK, I just never liked big paper bags with takeout food.....

"CPK" isn't top of the pizza game nor is it ever a disappointment. I stopped trying their so-called best dishes because I think they are all a buck or two too much in price. But see me come in for a $7-approx Fennel Sausage Flatbread or Mushroom and Spinach Flatbread, with subtle cheese which is how I like it. Sometimes a light green lunch: Asparagus and Arugula Salad. Note to readers: I'm a white guy. By the way, I like the service here at the Stoneridge Mall location. What was her name? Sarah? Angela? Whoever. They treat me like respect even for being the small order guy that I am. #questforpeace

I liked this one quite a bit. I've frequented this chain a few times and this was definitely one of the better restaurants I've been to. It nice and big and the staff was pretty friendly. The managers came around. They weren't that busy and the servers seemed a bit frantic. Unable to stay up with our drink order. I'd go back again.
yum yum yum. perfect for a quick lunch or a nice dinner. delicious food and good service.

The food is exactly what you expect, good and portions are well sized. What made this meal though, was the excellent service from Juliet. She was friendly, attentive and made excellent suggestions. She told us why certain dishes were her favorites, and that helped me narrow my selections. Her reviews were spot on and I am so glad to have taken her advice. I had the half order California Fields salad and the watermelon was so sweet and juicy and paired perfectly with the dressing, feta and pistachios. My partner had the half order Italian Chopped salad and said it was delicious. One of our sons had the ravioli and practically licked the bowl clean, while the other had the turkey club with Caesar salad and only finished half. The recommendations of Butter cake and Belgian Chocolate soufflé cake were exactly what we wanted, and perfect to share amongst the four of us. I will definitely return and hope to have Juliet as our server again because I know she will recommend the absolute best CPK has to offer.

Came here for a girls' lunch recently. Our server was trying reallllllly hard to upsell us the whole time. Did we want mimosas or wine? (no, we were both driving) Okay, how about an extra appetizer? No drinks other than water? How about dessert? Actually, are you all done yet??? It was kinda annoying. Also, before we'd even taken a bite he stopped by to check on us, then like 20 more times during the meal. I appreciate the top-up of the water glasses, but it's totally not necessary to check on us that much. Especially when it's clear we are going to have girl time and chat while eating. :) I don't think we really ended up staying much longer than any other table around us, so the rush was not needed. Anyway, the food itself was delicious. We had the summer special arugula/watermelon/strawberry salad. Last time I had watermelon in a salad (somewhere else) I thought it was gross, but this one was great. The dressing went really well with it. And then we shared my all-time favorite CPK pizza, the Jamaican Jerk Chicken. Sweet and spicy, chicken, peppers, thin crust....mmmmm. I am drooling just thinking about it. It was prepared well and we gobbled everything up. Wouldn't necessarily come back to this location due to the service, but CPK food is definitely a treat.

Very poor service. We were given dirty plate and no silverware. When requested to get another fork for my child, server asked to pick up the one from the floor. Called the manager who got very defensive. She Got us a new server who was okay. Still no red pepper with pizza. We had to start serving ourselves. Only reason we have 2 stars is because the good was decent.

Came here on a Thursday and we were seated right away. Overall service and dining experience was fine, nothing special, but nothing particularly bad either. I ordered a turkey club sandwich with a cesar salad. It was fairly large, so I ate only about half of it and asked for a box so I could take it home. Rather than giving me the box so that I could do it myself, the waitress brought my food to the back where she (or someone else, who knows...) placed it in box for me. It was nicely packaged, so I decided to bring it to work the next day so I could have it for lunch. Brought it to work with me and ate the remainder of the salad first, which still tasted good. I took a bite out of the sandwich, and a piece of lettuce fell out. Wanna know what I found in the sandwich right where the lettuce was? A short, wavy piece of black HAIR. ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING. Thank God that piece of lettuce fell out, otherwise I probably wouldn't have even seen the hair. Definitely lost my appetite after that. Seriously though, what are your cooks doing back there and how does a piece of hair like that get into someone's food?! Yeah, probably won't be going to this restaurant anymore.
The food here is amazing. Even though there was a line, it was not that long of a wait. I order the avocado egg rolls and it was delicious. Highly recommended :)

I forgot how tasty cpk is! Yeah it's like going to the Cheesecake Factory or BJs, but you won't be disappointed.  They added new items, but still have their unique pizzas available. Everything seems fresh and healthy. They have apps, small plates, flatbreads, pizza, pasta, soups, salads, and yummy desserts. Btw. When did they change their free bread??? Instead of the cold slices of sourdough with a side of butter, they now have a French roll with a tasty red pepper olive oil dip!!! And yes, please try the chicken tortilla soup!!! Chunky and satisfying. Don't forget to try the butter cake with ice cream. Warm buttery cake with a scoop of vanilla ice cream on top. Drooooool. A plus for effort.

First of all this was the first time ever stepping into CPK that I've had poor service. Kylie was our server with poor customer service. She took our order and in the middle of ordering she threw a huge yawn. Wow! Well we've alerted the managers on duty also they are sure to be alerted by their corporate office as well. I informed corporate office of the poor customer service today. Never will we be coming to THIS location. Poor service!

Came here today after some shopping and it was pretty busy! We waited maybe ten minutes tops and got seated. Our waiter right off the bat was super quick and although some may view him as kind of impersonal we enjoyed his quickness and efficiency. We ended up ordering the chicken dumplings which were delicious as our main appetizer. I ordered a white pizza with roasted chicken added, my girlfriend ordered the chicken Alfredo and my friend ordered a spicy pizza (forgot the actual name). We all enjoyed our food and would gladly come back here again if we're in the area next time! Place is clean, efficient and tasty!

CPK is one of our favorite places to dine and we go there very often. I even have the rewards program. This evening we were shopping in the mall and the mall closed at 9pm. We were hungry and was happy to find out that there was CPK attached to mall and was noted to close at 10pm. SCORE!  6 of us got to the door at 9:15pm and they turned us away because they said they were closing, even though it said clearly on their Website that they open from 11AM to 10PM.  Debra, manager said they were closing and that the website provided us the wrong information. With no hesitation or apology, they should have just been straight forward about closing early because it was slow. CPK Stoneridge unfortunately doesn't feel like a place we plan to try and go again.

This is the only CPK we come to. Great food and awesome customer service. I was very impressed by our waitress Zoey, she was outstanding. Prompt and efficient. Zoey went above and beyond and check in on us regularly. We live in the Walnut creek area but ALWAYS  drive out  and head over to Pleasanton because of the fast and courteous service.

Had to try it and see what all the hype was about. So not impressed! Why can't you get a "well done" pizza anywhere? My husband and I both asked for our pizzas well done. They didn't even looked fully cooked! Lots of toppings, but no flavor. First and last time trying any California Pizza. Round Tables and Mountain Mikes have much better pizza.

Eh... not really worth it, my mom, sister and I popped in for a quick lunch and decided that there is  never a need to go back. 1. After being seated, we were promptly ignored for 15+ minutes, our actual server wasn't event the one to acknowledge us then. 2. I  got one of the managers attention and was able to order drinks, appetizer and entrees.Will say the manager was very nice and got drinks/water very quickly and even delivered some of the food.  3. We ordered a Thai something or other salad and it was so obviously old lettuce, it was probably pre-mixed with dressing. Also, way over-dressed, to the point that there was a pool of dressing on the plate. Also ordered a flatbread (3.75 stars- decent but not stupendous), and lettuce wraps (4.5 stars for the fresh lettuce and size of the dish) 4. Once our actual waiter did come to the table she couldn't seem to remember small things we asked for; lemons, napkins the check... we had to ask more than once.

My friends and I had lunch here and it was good as ever.  We got a table right away even though it was a busy Saturday lunch time.  We did wait a bit for the waiter to take our order but he did come by before that and say he would be back in a few minutes.  I like when waiters do that.  You know they know you are there.   I had the pear and gorgonzola thin crust pizza.  Its one of my favorites.  It has tons of cheese, hazelnuts, and salad on top.  Yum!  It was nice and crispy as I like it.   Not too greasy.  My friends had the California Club pizza and the 5 cheese pizza.  They both enjoyed their pizzas and ate the whole things.  I took a couple slices of mine home and they tasted good cold later that night. This is definitely a good spot to come for lunch if you don't want to hit Cheesecake Factory and wait for a table. Food is good. Service is good. I am sure we will be back.
Mickayla was my waitress today and she literally is the best waitress I've ever had.

Love this place since I was a teen. Great food! Love the BBQ chicken salad. Tastes so fresh. They really honored the Veterans with a empty table in their honor. Very classy. The hostess Yasmine was upbeat, and friendly and sat me promptly. She stood out to me because she seemed to make personal connections with other customers. I saw her interacting with a small family and their child sitting next to my table. My server Camille was attentive. She was bubbly and smiled as she spoke to me.

I remember when this place was geared towards an "upscale fast food" experience. Now, it's a straight up restaurant. When that transition happened, the prices went up. The food is good, the pizza is more of a thin crust artisan style. The service was not as attentive as I would've liked but the servers and managers have always been very friendly.

We were seated immediately, service was fantastic, and the food was very good. The club egg rolls are amazing. Our food order was taken quickly and everything came out super fast! Laura, our waitress was prompt and took great care of us.

The last two visits to CPK have been excellent. Normally, mall restaurants are not my thing, but once in a while, I'm left with a choice - eat at the mall or starve! Thank goodness for CPK at Stoneridge Mall. CPK serves up really good food in a pleasant atmosphere with above-average service. I like their selection of pizzas, salads and they even serve a few decent beers! While I won't go out of my way to head to the mall for a meal, it's great knowing there is a nice place to dine while there. 4 solid stars CPK - great job!

Cpk is one of my go-to dine out spots with my son. My son loves the pizza and pasta. The pizza crust is perfectly crisp with just the right amount of toppings. The pasta is well coated with sauce and very flavorful. We really enjoy the parmesan cream and pesto cream sauce. I also really love the Chinese chicken salad. The sangria's are very good too. I like the Caribbean one. Along with the alcohol, it has juicy blueberries, slices of tangy apple, and a beautiful pineapple garnish. Paul was our server today. He's excellent at what he does. We ordered within 5 mins of being seated. He got the drinks and bread out within 2 mins. Then the food came out by 10-15 min of ordering. I really appreciate the hospitality too. He made sure we were ok and if we needed anything he'd get it. I gave the four stars because the hostess didn't smile as we were waiting for someone to come take our reservation. She also didn't look me in the eye while asking how many I had in my party. When she sat us, I felt like she was rushing to get us seated. Not caring at all. She just said Paul will be our server while looking at the wall with no smile and then walked away. Even though she was very rude, I still said thank you twice and no response from this girl. I wish I could've got her name but I couldn't catch it because she was in a rush. Mind you the restaurant was not busy yet. Came in Sunday Nov. 29th around 4:30pm. She has a thin build, wears glasses and seamed to not give a damn!!

I like CPK but there were too many problems  with my wife's  food. It came out cold and had like 6 little pieces  of chicken on it we brought  it to the managers attention and she took the plate back and we were expecting hot pasta with more chicken but it came back out Luke warm with the same amount of chicken on it. So we finally asked the server to microwave  the food which she did but the other issue was the chicken. If I'm paying  3.00 for chicken I expect a full breast not a half. We had 2 different people approach our table and ask us about the chicken but didn't  solve the problem one person was like if you want more we have to charge you 1.50 and then another person was like well we can take the chicken charge off. I haven't  been to CPK in years and I most definitely  will not ever come back to this location.
CPK Pleasanton customer service is very bad. We spoke with the manager three times and he did not want to resolve the problems.

Very good service given the day and shopping crowds.  Lowest wait time of the nearby restaurants.  Only problem is the bleeding music that is WAY TOO loud. I come to visit with friends , not to listen to Muzak at 11 :(.

As always, very good service and great food. This location never dissappoints. Michelle our waitress was very friendly and helpful. The food and aperizers we ordered, were really good. Definitely recommend this CPK to anyone

Out of all honesty I've been to multiple places to eat but none of them treated me like Chris my server did. He has the best personality out! Definitely coming back and looking forward to him being my server again.

I gave this place two chances and they failed me both times. Ordered two different pasta dishes and they tasted like frozen pasta. It was not worth 16 bucks at all!! I could make better pasta than that and I don't even cook! Never again!
This is the first time I eat at California Pizza and I loved it. We ordered 9 different plates, oh my god i didn't expect it to be so delicious and filling . I will definitely go again soon

What a great experience. I HIGHLY recommend Sarah as a waitress, you won't be disappointed. She's a hard worker and doesn't mind confirming certain ingredients in foods especially regarding allergies. Thank you Sarah your the best!!!... Enjoy your shots!!!...when you get off of course :-)

Went out heading for another place but due to the outrageous wait times, looked in at CPK and there was no wait at all...walked right in. Our server, Chris, recognized us, knew what we usually ordered, down to the "extra beets and no tomatoes" on my Cobb salad.   He was super attentive, kept our glasses full or tea/soda, Knew I was going to use my Pizza Dough reward and overall was just great.   Servers like that keep us coming back...and looking to sit in his section.  Thanks Chris for another great dinner out!  Great job CPK with your excellent servers!

What happened!  This place was always a guaranteed good meal.  Not today, 12/30/15 at 12:35pm.   I parked in the 'take out' parking, got out of my car and was greated by the takeout person who called me the wrong name three times and after the 3rd time I told her she can call me that name all day, it still won't change my name and thats not my food.  I ordered gorganzola/pear pizza and my favorite hummas.  The hummas was so loaded with tomatoes that it should have been called tomato with a garnish of hummas.  All severly watered down, it left 3 tablespoons of hummas and the pizza was cold.  Really bad food, and for the first time for me too!  I'm so disappointed and won't be back, good thing is I do have lots of other choices. Sad, this used to be a favorite of mine.

I have never tried CPK pizza but after trying it for the first time, I definitely do like it more than some other pizza places mainly because it was overall less greasy (or didn't left you with a greasy feeling) and everything tasted extremely fresh.  As a party of 2, we went to CPK on a Tuesday a little bit before noon and before the lunch rush  hour. There weren't a lot of people there (maybe about 5 tables seated) but was greeted with big smiles from the managing partner and the host who sat us down at a booth. The waitress overall throughout our whole meal was very kind in offering advice, if we needed water or anything more, bringing us bread to start, and also was smart enough to give me smaller bills for change so that I was able to tip her a fair amount. We ordered the "two in a bowl" soup, spicy chipotle chicken pizza, and California club pizza.  The two in a bowl soup consisted of half tortilla soup and half pea and barley soup. Both soups were too thick of a consistency for me and I felt like it could almost pass as a dip instead of a coup. The tortilla soup I enjoyed more than the pea and barley. The pea and barley soup just tasted odd, gritty, and a little bitter. I won't be ordering the soup again.  The two pizzas, on the bright side, were both delicious! The spicy chipotle chicken definitely was spicy but the side cilantro based sauce helped a little with the heat and added more flavor to the overall pizza. I was impressed by the flavors. The california club pizza was a little bit odd but I liked the overall concept and taste of it. It seemed like they were trying to turn a salad into a pizza which they did very well. My only gripe is that the bacon the part that threw off the whole pizza in that I tasted almost only bacon when eating the pizza. Another type of meat would have been a nice alternative.

RACIST AND RUDE STAFF. Veterans Day 2014. We are a Chinese and Filipino family. Told the server, Will, I was a veteran, and he kept telling me how any pizza I asked about was not free. I made it clear I knew which pizzas were free since I was holding the menu and was pointing each and every time at the other menu when asking about a pizza (not the special Veteran's Day one). Asked Will if he could tell me what was on the special, the Korean BBQ. He said it just be like the Thai Pizza with a peanut sauce, as they are both Asian pizzas. Yeah, makes sense... He screws up the order and almost gets us 3 pizzas after I clearly told him I didn't want the Korean BBQ because he no clue what was on it. Later on in the evening, he forgets to bring us soup. Then Will says the real kicker line: "We got Dragon Ball Z going on here or what?" Because there is no one around us that he could be referring to since he's  looking straight at us. And there aren't any Asian families nearby. Just us. No Dragon Ball Z t-shirts, toys, nothing. Will has completely lost his mind. And then he follows immediately with, "What's your daughter's name?" Very fake and creepy. When we ask to replace the broccilini, falsely advertised as "baby broccoli" (really???), another server throws a hissy fit and yells at us: "That's how the dish always comes, so next time, ask for the macaroni." Seriously? So I speak to the  manager, and kudos to M.J. She is the only sane and professional one there apparently. She immediately apologized and offered to get us a new pizza (Will forgot the bacon I told him to add to it twice.), and then took responsibility for her poor training of the employees. Finally, someone who at least claims to understand leadership! She comped us, but we are never going back to this bigoted place. A corporate complaint is forthcoming.
A good place to eat and drink and relax after the madness of the mall. Servers are always cool and the cooks are very talented.  A good time out.
Service is good! Our server was Camilie , she was fast & friendly! Food was So so, but Avocado egg rolls were so delicioussss!! Defitnetly will be coming back for more!!

Would've been 5 stars if they could figure out who our waiter was from the get go...  But, overall - good service from host to manager and eventually our server.   Salad was awesome, pizzas & pastas were delicious and it was fast! We'll be back!

We were pleasantly surprised by the delicious pizza and salad at this chain!  We usually avoid chains but this CPK has got their act together.  We ordered the chipotle chicken pizza and the Moroccan salad.  The chipotle chicken pizza had just the right savory and spicy combination and the Moroccan salad was a bursting mouthful of goodness; roasted beets, butternut squash, avocado, lettuce and tomatoes, sweetness from cranberries and dates, toasted peanuts, chicken, and a light dressing.  The decor was quite pleasant, too.  And the service was outstanding, truly.
LOVE LOVE LOVE! Absolutely my favorite pizza. Especially the barbecue chicken pizza with bacon! Yum. Minus one star for being a bit overpriced for the size of the pizza now :(

First off our server was so late on taking our order, she forgot my sons drink, didn't check up on us we had to flag down a manger walking by looking like Cruella Deville who just didn't give a f she asked me if I made a complain last time I was here? What the hell lady I just want my check and a box what kind of manger asks that question?? No I didn't make a complain last time we rarely even go here but this will be my last time I go to this location. Food was good but the customer service ruined it for me!!!

We have come here a few times as a family and never been disappointed.  The wait period is never too long even though there is always a group of people waiting before you.  The servers are always attentive, the service is quick, food is delicious.
Yummy just what I needed... Good service good food.. Good drink menu.. That's it nothing more to add.. I hate this just want to add a little something and its never enough to post

Pro: Got in right away on a Friday night.  Very nice server. Very yummy bread!  Con: It's really loud & dark in there.  Didn't really enjoy my salad. I got a Chinese chicken salad. there was a lot of dressing & it kinda tasted like dusty peanuts. I don't know why... but it wasn't my favorite flavor. I'd try it again. Maybe I ordered a dud. I do like their frozen pizzas!

My husband and I wanted to just have soup and salad for dinner so after a movie we drove over to CPK Pleasanton.  What makes a good meal is good food but what makes a good meal great is a fantastic server. Yecenia is an excellent server!  She went above and beyond the call of duty with her outstanding workmanship.  I really wanted a good soup and could not decide.  In my mind I was thinking, "It sure would be nice to taste the different soups." Did our server just read my mind?  She offered to let me try various soups and voilà my hubby and I both found 2 different soups we enjoyed.  He ordered the Tortilla and I order the Farmer's Market which was delicious. I have to also compliment the manager, he was very friendly, smooth, unrattled and as we were eating I observed him really taking care of business.  He made eye contact with me a few times which tells me he is really engaged and wants to scan the room to make sure his guest are happy.  He obviously makes great hiring decisions because Yecenia was truly on top of her game; she was very attentive, helpful, and proactive.  Her service rivals that of fine dining restaurants. Next time we are at the CPK Pleasanton location (and we will be back!) we will be sure to ask to be seated with Yecenia!  Bravo!

I love CPK. Good food and almost always great service until today. It is Sunday around 530pm. The hubby and baby were already seated and my older daughter and I was on the way. I had the jogger stroller with me.  We walked into a busy waiting area as expected. I see 2 jogger strollers parked next to hostess stand. Keep in mind for you non parents, jogger strollers are bulky. I could have parked mine in front of those 2 blocking them in, but I see a spot by the front door next to fire extinguisher.  Because the stroller would be blocking the fire extinguisher and it was right by the front door, I asked hostess Mariah if it was OK to leave my stroller there. She answers me with a quick yes then looks back at the other hostess and started talking. I stand there and wait, wanted to make sure she knows its right next to a  fire extinguisher. She answers again quickly then goes back talking to the other hostess. Geez. I was irritated. That was horrible customer service. When we got to our table, It took me a minute to get over how horrible that was.  Maybe Mariah needs to revisit customer service 101.  Anyway here comes our server Kristine. She saved the day. Excellent customer service and good food.

It always seems like I go to CPK as a consequence of long wait times at Cheesecake Factory. Not a bad thing though!  Setting: The first thing I notice about restaurant is that it is dark and yellow. The interior just doesn't feel very pleasing to me, especially at night. I do like that there is a lot of seating available though! Service: Mediocre. The waitress checked up on us when she needed to, but she was always very friendly. Food: Make sure you ask for the complimentary bread if they don't give it to you right away. The warm bread plus the oil mixture is so good! I ordered the Works pizza, which has mushrooms, sausage, onions, black olives, and pepperoni. It was pretty good, and the crust was very filling!  I know I'll find my way back to this restaurant in the nearby future.
The Alfredo pasta had no Alfredo .. The BBQ pizza had no BbQ chicken zx actually I could count 5 prices for five small slices with the crust so hard I can't tel you . Pls don't go !!!
Excellent as always. Wish they had more choices for vegetarians. However they do offer to make it without the meat

Good food and good service, came out quick and they were attentive to the needs. Manager came and thanked us for having our recidal dinner there. Only got 4 stars due to the constant flies that seemed to be all around the table. Could not eat without swatting them away. Very frustrating.
Sorry but my wife and I both got the worst  food poisoning , it took me almost a week to feel 100%

Some time ago me and my family went to California Pizza Kitchen for my belated birthday dinner. As soon as we got through the doors we received some of the best-restaurant service I have ever received. We got seated relatively quickly, actually we were seated a lot faster than we were anticipating considering that this was a Saturday evening at dinnertime. First of all I need to shout out the manager on duty Debbie; she was AMAZING. She constantly came by out table to check on us to see if we were getting everything ok and made pleasant small-talk with us. She made our first experience personal and not many restaurants provide that kind of service. Second our waitress was also top-notch. She was fast, took great care of us, and was definitely on top of her game! Third the food was AMAZING. I am usually not a fan of thin-crust pizza but I ordered the Sicilian and it was one of the best pizza's that I ever had! We all ordered different pizzas and sampled each others and none of us left disappointed. I will absolutely recommend this restaurant to anybody and I will definitely be going back again and again!

I will come back again for that wonderful smiling experience of having quality pizza with outstanding cocktail (sangria) served in a pleasant ambience. What else? Everything was great about it. I would surely recommend it.

Went in for dinner on a Tuesday night and experienced the WORST service possible. The two stars are for the semi-decent food.  Waited 15 mins for our order to be taken while the restaurant was 20% of capacity. Took forever to get our water...had to chaise the manager down to get the check. Avoid at all cost....

Came here to grab a bit as we enjoyed the one back in Florida. We were extremely not tired,3 hour time difference in coast's. We felt out of place as this Asian lady kept starting at us. But whatever. Other than that a very nice atmosphere.

I went to this restaurant today with my family and I had a very bad customer service. When we got the table, the server did not serve us the water. We asked him three times. We were done eating our pizza but kept asking him for water. I had my little daughter with me and she was thirsty. I asked two different servers but no one give us water. I felt racial discrimination at this restaurant. I will never in my life go back to this restaurant.

The pizza is amazing here, I love this place! They use fresh ingredients, the crust tastes great, I love that they have whole wheat crust.. And they also have goat cheese!!  Service has always been good, a d pizzas always came out pretty fast.. And the servers are awesome, I've omitted ingredients before & never had an order come out wrong! Their combination pizzas are really good, or you can build your own! It's always busy in here he every time I go, you can call an order in & pick it up if you're not in the mood to dine in!

The chipotle chicken tastes amazing with the special dipping sauce. The sausage poblano flat bread is very good as a start. You can always do half and half on pizza. I also tried margagretta. It is the worst margagretta I've had. So little tomatoes makes it too cheesy and greasy.

Last Saturday my family came from out of town and the PF Chang's and other restaurant had a 1.5+ hour wait, so we came into CPK as a second choice. We were very pleased. The service staff was friendly and the kids menu had a .99 cent sundae dessert which thrilled my nephew. We shared it and it made for the most memorable moment of the day because I went on and on about a $1 ice cream and how special that was today. It felt like an old man moment but it treasured my memory of the day. Thanks CPK, the pizza was solid too!

Pizza pasta all pretty good or maybe we were just too hungry!  Ended up here as there was a  long wait for the cheesecake factory.  We were seated promptly and our waiter was busy but he did stop by and introduce himself and said that he would be back. Jesse was professional and courteous and treated my kids with respect.  Added points for that, great dining service cause of said waiter.  Bread was brought out with dipping oil,  we attacked it like there was no tomorrow.  Pizza was fresh and hot and tasty.  We got the Hawaiian pizza and enjoyed it very much.  The garlic parmensan fettucine was piping hot and tasty. Overall,  food came out quick, short wait for a table.

Great place to eat in the mall considering the minimal options. Entrance is outside of the mall, with easy mall access once you're done dining. Ample seating if you're dining in and your greeted immediately by the host or hostess.        To start the gist was very inviting and even took the time to ask about your day, real nice and classy gesture on his part. As for ou r waitress, had a rough beginning and a tad slow on bringing out the complimentary bread and dipping sauce. She seemed a little rushed and overwhelmed so only took notice and waited patiently.        Today I went with the vegan pizza with a side salad and cup of pea soup, I know not the most extravagant of choices but I'm trying to stay somewhat healthy since I'm in a pizza joint. The food was great and I was very pleased with toppings on my veggie pizza. It had a mix of broccoli and mushrooms that was perfectly blended together. I was able to combine it with a Caesar salad and add a cup of pea soup. Overall great combination and best of all I ate a guilt free meal. Our waitress was great in the end and periodically checked in on us throughout our meal while providing refills in our drinks, I'll definitely come back in and experience more on the menu.

Came here last night with my parents, and our server "Joe" was so attentive and good-natured, he had us smiling during the whole meal (he is fantastic!). It took a long time for the food to be served, and when we ordered the red velvet cake for dessert, it was brought to the table and taken back in a mixup because it "was frozen and not ready". But the female manager gave us an alternative dessert to us for free, so we greatly appreciate their efforts and dedication to good customer service.

spinach artichoke dip - pretty good wild mushroom pizza - pretty good veggie pizza - pretty good the original bbq chicken chopped salad - pretty good california club pizza - good margherita pizza - good asparagus + spinach spaghettini - pretty good bolognese spaghetti - good hawaiian pizza - good service has been good, but the wait can be long

The food is overpriced but you get better quality and really excellent tasting food. I got the soy ginger glazed steamed chicken dumplings. I was pretty amazed what I  ate, and it was overpriced. So food is 5 but prices were $$$. I was going for the rib eye but it had only  serving with arugula salad and some roasted fingerling potatoes for almost $30. I got some butter cake for dessert with whipped cream. It's like a Gooey Butter Cake but had some brown sugar streusel inside the cake. Kristen,the server asked if I wanted ice cream with it. But I chose to have it with whipped cream. The butter cake tasted like it had a lot of butter with brown sugar streusel inside of it and had a flan like custard burnt on top of it. I guess this is their propriety desserts they serve on their menu. This is really good butter cake which is good for 1 person and it was perhaps 4.5 inches in diameter and great for 1 person or 2 people. It was like a light, custardy rich cake. You should always get the pastas, flatbread and their gourmet pizzas, salads and appetizers are awesome here. Either get the butter cake, salted caramel pudding or the key lime pie. Their food is great but I thought the prices were kind of overpriced. Average price is $9 to $30. I can understand why they serve $30 for the primed rib eye with blue cheese butter, roasted fingerling potatoes and a side of arugula salad for $30. This item is the only beef dinner item on the menu because they signature items are the gourmet style pizzas and pasta dishes. Today's food experience was phenomenal because I just ordered the soy ginger glazed chicken dumplings that are steamed and had a mix of soy ginger glazed sauce, green scallions, and toasted sesame seeds on top. The dumplings were wrapped with made from scratch wonton wrappers and ground chicken were perfectly seasoned and cooked. I said, this was presented very well and the taste was phenomenal and cost around $8. I had the butter cake for dessert. I forgot to take pictures because I was so hungry, and kept on eating it until it was gone. I thought my food experience here was amazing like 4.5/5. This waiting time for this restaurant on a late weekday afternoon is less than 5 minutes, and you were seated promptly and the hostess was really courteous and pleasant. You felt welcome and comfortable when you are asked where do you want to sit. The server, Kristen was very pleasant and was approachable when she had no problem about any requests or if you had any questions about the menu. They want to make sure you are treated well and no bias or favorites. That's an A grade for customer service. I have seen an older guy who has been trained being a GM, and expediter in the restaurant. The prices seemed overpriced because average range is $8 to $25. But these menu items are made from scratch and made with fresh ingredients. Perhaps better than P.F. Chang's and The Cheesecake Factory. P.F.Chang's - the ambiance was very trendy and modern, but the customer service was absent and subdued. Servers and the hostess seemed disinterested in their work. The food was very bland, and the options were not very creative. So I really don't like it all. Overhyped - yes. The Cheesecake Factory - the menu has too many options that cater a Skinnylicious option or regular option. Desserts are best here - different flavors of cheese cakes, dessert cakes and some signature desserts, cocktails are great here too. I would say their servers are kind of plenty but food experience can be confusing. So the food here is sometimes comforting, but not really flavorful as in the California Pizza Kitchen. So the food here is 3.5/5. This is really great- if there was a happy hour in the late afternoon with some drinks. Then go there. They have a tv which is perfect especially if its on ESPN. California Pizza Kitchen - the food experience is phenomenal and just read my review mentioned above. So next time, if you want something different like a pizza, pasta or maybe wanted to try their desserts. Go here and you won't be disappointed.  I noticed the ambiance is very subtle but the seating here is very spacious. So it is inviting and makes you comfortable to dine here. I enjoyed my time here, and will probably come here soon. Service is a 5. Cleanliness and ambiance is 5. So overall, it is 4/5.
Good food, nice service. Perfect place for lunch or for dinner after shopping at the stoneridge mall

Mugi was our server tonight and she was amazing!!!!! She was fast, sweet and down right the best server we have ever had here? We come here often and her amazing customer service prompted this review! Yumky food too lol, we had the strawberry lime margaritas, chicken tequila fettuccine and a bunch of other stuff! :)

The star was for the food if at best was mediocre. I can order the same thing from Domino's and it would, dare I say, taste better. Service was in the top of worst times ever. Only gave us drinks and then an hour later when I had to call a server to ask about our food she came and told us food was ready, then left for 20 minutes. Mind you 3 parties came and left in that time. What did I order? A small pizza and salads duo. By the time I got my food the salads was warm and mushy. Clearly it left out and forgotten.

We came in at 9pm and we ordered our food and this happens to be a one of be rudest servers and says I'm busy to get your order even though the restaurant is 80% free, on a Sunday. Will never return again and take my business somewhere else. Especially when I was going to use them for my business for 500 employees.  The management needs to learn a thing or two about hiring the right staff and management.
Love this location! They have great outdoor seating. Have never had a bad meal here or bad service. Always enjoy a good lunch with pizza and salad!

Long time California Pizza kitchen customer.  With that being said I have noticed a decline in the quality.  Went Friday, the waitress was marginal was not very "up" on vegan or vegetarian options and seemed bothered. I ended up passing and just got hummus.. However, the folks I was with ordered a pizza with ham and pineapple...  Well, when the pizza arrived it looked like a football shape as opposed to a pie.. Not a huge deal because the waitress said well here you go, we are bringing you another one out since this was "messed" up.. Messed up not sure they should eat it. Well they did and the pineapple was almost a white color and tasted as if it just came out of can and had been in that can at least a year ... Gross, the 2nd "non messed up" pizza wasn't any better.  Very disappointed.   Will not be returning.
Good place for people like me who do not eat meat. However their ceviche is more like guacamole with shrimp but they have very good shrimp tacos!

This review is for the server HALEY at this location only. She was so friendly and focused even under pressure. She was great. Otherwise I would give cpk a 1 star.  Came here w my family and had a terrible experience. They were obviously understaffed and hopefully they don't run their business this way all the time.  Food took forever and drinks took even longer. The whole night was spent waiting 20 minutes for for each drink we ordered, and food came out bland and dry. One person in my party ordered the half Cobb  salad while another ordered the full. They are the EXACT same size. Don't bother spending the extra 4$ for the full. Pasta was dry and soup and chicken piccata plate extremely salty.  I used to love cpk but haven't been in a while. The menu is significantly smaller with boring items and poor execution. It used to taste fresh and modern but they are stuck back in 2000. Sad. Haley was obviously very busy and didn't have any support staff. I didn't see a busser come to our table once to fill drinks or remove plates. Management needs to know how to step in and help the floor during dinner rush, otherwise bad menu combined with long ticket times at no fault to the server will create a closed restaurant. Never going back to this or any other location.

So disappointing. I had fish tacos. They were expensive ($15) but I love fish tacos. I kid you not, each taco had 3  pieces of fish that were maybe - maybe - 1/2 inch square each. They rest of the taco was stuffed with cabbage. That's ridiculous. We will not be retur

Food: Waldorf Salad 1/2, Bianco Flatbread, MahiMahi Tacos =$38 (this felt pricey for 3 items during lunch) Drinks: None Ambience: Standard CPK with outside seating. I had heels on and it was slippery near the bar area, so I had to watch my steps.  Staff: Friendly and helpful to each other. Everyone rotated responsibilities even if it was not theirs. They kept the line rotating. Parking: I could not find this location for the life of me because it is pushed a little back from the angle I came in at, but I found the yellow curbside pickup stalls to figure it out. Stoneridge mall is busy during lunch time hour.

Two for two. - my pizza not made correctly. With that said, the staff is so friendly, you can't stay mad. Their sales are amazing and service fantastic so I will keep trying for a correctly made order of pizza!

Ordered a shrimp scampi zucchini fettuccine for to-go. I loved this dish with lots of zucchini & a light portion of pasta. But this time I could only find a few pieces of fettuccine; almost couldn't see them in the dish.

My son and I went to CPK located in the Stoneridge Mall in PLEASANTON.  We had 2 hours to wait for my iPhone 6 to be repaired at the Apple Store. We were able to get a table booth right away which was awesome since it was really busy at the time.  We then were introduced to by our server Melissa. She asked us if we had been there before and I told her it had been awhile. Melissa then asked if we wanted some beverages so we could read through the menu. Melissa brought them right away and then started to let us know what was new on the menu. Then she gave us a few moments to decide and then in the meantime she brought out our nice and hot fresh bread with olive oil. Then Melissa took our order my son ordered the personal pizza barbecue and chicken and I ordered fettuccine with shrimp and chicken. Let me tell you the food was so amazing.  Then Melissa was always there filling our raspberry ice tea and checking up on us making sure we were ok. Then before you knew it our food was served. Then Melissa continued to always tend to our needs along with making sure her other guests were taken care of at the same time and with a smile on her face. Melissa then brought me a Togo box and a dessert menu and we ordered the salted Carmel pudding.  OMG it was more amazing than I could ever hoped for.  Melissa then gave me our check and I thanked her for being the BEST SERVER AND MAKING OUR DINNER EXPERIENCE EVEN MORE SPECIAL. I told her that not everyday we have a server that is exceptional and she was definitely exceptional tonight serving us. My son and I gave her a 20% tip that was well deserved. She had told me in the beginning about the survey and my son and I were more than happy to do the survey and brag to management of how exceptional Melissa was as our server.  Debra the manager didn't come to our table however I did mention to her on our way out how exceptional Melissa was as our server and how happy we were to do the survey and fill out the rewards card and I hope she wins the contest b/c she definitely deserves to win.  My son drove about 2 hours from where we were staying this weekend and he would gladly drive that amount to have Melissa as our server again.  The service we received from Melissa and the amazing food will continue to bring my son and I back to California Pizza Kitchen in Stoneridge Mall for years to come. I hope upper management knows that Melissa is an exceptional employee b/c each time we have her as a server we will continue to fill out the surveys and do a review on yelp so she can get the recognition she deserves. CHECK OUT THE PHOTO OF MY BILL IN MY PROFILE THAT MELISSA SAID SHE WUD POST ON CPK DOOR

So pleasantly surprised by this location. I come here occasionally, and I always have the same chicken salad. Today, there was something a little bit hard in my salad that wasn't supposed to be there and I felt like I was about to break a tooth so I pulled it out and showed it to my waitress who showed it to her manager who comped my bill. I was so impressed. This is what customer service is about.  I'll come again.

We visited this CPK location for the first time.  We were very impressed with the kid-friendly atmosphere, which seems to be a trademark of CPK's in the Bay Area. We uave been to CPK's in the Washington state and other countries, but we have never seen a very hands-on approach with the customers as much as this location and the one in the Santama Row area. I love how CPK changes their menu, by offering unique creations while keeping their classic favorites. Before heading out, we were offered a couple of first-timer cards, which offered free stuffs for our next visit.  Will surely come back to enjoy another good meal with our kids.

My sister held a combined birthday party for her 2 younger kids at California Pizza Kitchen this morning before the restaurant opened for the lunch rush. What a great idea.  The kids loved making their own customized pizzas. They were engaged, relatively corralled in a safe space and the clean up was not our responsibility.

I think  CPK targets families and teenagers. I have eaten at several branches and found their food OK but not great. Today was no exception.  I had the Caesar salad and smashed pea soup lunch combo for $8. The salad had lettuce which wasn't very fresh. The dressing was ok, nothing special. The soup was just ok. Like many chain restaurants, mediocrity is what you get and for many that works just fine. For me, I leave uninspired.

For $10-$18, the food is not bad.  I ordered an appetizer and there were 5 pieces of cauliflower.  Service was pleasant but what I didn't appreciate was the waitress circling the suggested 20% gratuity.  In fact, when I did the math on the suggested percentages (with/without tax), they were at least 5% higher than indicated.  I don't know why the management team allows this but be aware.
Avocado egg rolls should be renamed to Avacado egg rolls with Bacon. Could not order This appetizer since it comes with bacon. Otherwise, good place to dine with family or friends.

Stay away ! Tasteless , bland and boring food. Very disappointed with service and food quality. We ordered mahi tacos ( which had no flavor ) , then a California veg pizza ( which was prob frozen before served to us ) and guac/chips ( which were bla ! ) . The only thing good was mac n cheese !  Extremely poor taste and service was horrible; they simply brushed off our remarks.  The only reason ppl come here is because the wait at Cheesecake Factory / p.f Chang is too long. After this experience, I would much rather wait.

Great experience!  Despite the large crowd on a Friday evening, host at front desk was well organized and in command; did a great job taking names and estimated waits were spot on.  Server (Esmeralca) was fantastic...very polite and professional; made sure my family and I we're happy.  Food was good (esp pizza) and came out fast.  Overall great service.  I really like this place.

CPK has been a staple for me all throughout childhood. I remember when it was only a small store, and my dad would always order a personal cheese pizza to go for me. And now it's expanded into a huge restaurant! Today I got the lunch duo with a 7" mushroom and spinach pizza with Caesar salad on the side. Both were delicious and perfectly proportioned. Plus their complimentary bread is great!!! Service was a little slow, but it was a busy restaurant, and besides, I was too busy enjoying my company to notice. Overall, love coming to this place!

I never thought I'd spend all morning hanging out at a pizza restaurant, and that I would love every moment of it. But there we were, my daughter and I, with a couple dozen other 7-year olds and adult chaperones, jammed into a giant freezer in the back of a CPK, being shown around by the manager - a friendly man with a Texas drawl.  Minutes earlier, we'd arrived late for a birthday party, and I was wondering what we'd be doing in a pizza restaurant at 9 am on a Saturday. But to my pleasant surprise, it was a pizza making party! Yayyyy!  The kids first got a tour of the restaurant and kitchen. The manager showed them how the ordering system works, introduced them to the workers making Hawaiian pizzas (they use eight fresh pineapples daily), and quizzed them on how many total pizzas they sell (500, give or take). The kids got to see how dough is flattened, veggies cleaned, dishes washed, and food stored in the ginormous pantry and the aforementioned freezer.  Then it was on to the birthday table area to "handcraft" their individual pizzas. Each kid got a rolled out pie with fixings on the side - tomato sauce, cheese, ham, pepperoni, olives, mushrooms and so on. Their pizzas were numbered before baking so they had to eat what they made (never too early for that lesson in life!).  While the kids were busy, the adults were served pizza and beverages (I sure needed that coffee!). I spent time getting to know some of the other parents... with the kids being in a contained space there was no need to keep a constant eye on them!  Before I knew it, it was time for birthday cake, goodie bags, and to-go containers for leftovers. The staff were on their game and every thing was orderly and efficient.  Thank you birthday kid's parents and CPK, for a lovely morning - we all had a blast!

I can keep coming back to this place.  It is located at a nice place.  After hectic shopping, this would be a good place to check in and enjoy the food.  I've visited this restaurant a few times and it was always on weekends. The bread they serve while you wait for your food, was warm and tasty!  Pick a pizza of your choice.  You can't go wrong much.  I love Tostadas Pizza.  The habanero dip is excellent, very rich in flavor.  Salads are nice too.  Service is generally good.  But, you may have to wait longer when it is very crowded and it may test your patience, sometimes. This place can get busy and you could experience a long wait time.  Try to get your name in the queue and continue your shopping at near by shops to make best use of your wait time.

Honestly the food here is good but the main manager is extremely rude and instead of wanting to make his customers happy he only cares about taking your money at all costs. I am a regular here however now I'm really not sure I will be returning to this location. He ruined my Valentine's Day because of how rude he was. Don't waste your money, at least not at this location.

I'm only giving three stars Because Lauren, my waitress, was amazing!  Where do I start??? How about the cold bread! The bread you bring to the tables should be warm. I mean come on ha! And how about the bathroom sink that JUST started working. This place you can tell is ran cheaply. Whoever is the GM for this place should actually put money towards their establishment and not in their pockets- that's what I'm guessing is happening.  Like I said before- Lauren was fabulous and so attentive. For the rest- very run down. Get it together.

3.5 stars, rounded up to 4.  My son loves CPK.  Service I here is pretty standard and the food is consistent.  We come slightly early for lunch, and typically we do not need to wait. I get gift cards at Costco ($75 for $100 of gift cards) and for just my son and I, it lasts for a few meals. There is also a CPK app where you can earn $5 towards your bill for each $100 that you spend. My son loves their Mac and cheese, and I typically get a salad. Their pizzas are good too, and my husband likes their flatbreads options My son also just attended a birthday party here.  He had a lot of fun getting a tour of the kitchen and making his own pizza, although service was slow and unorganized for the party.  The birthday kid gets their own CPK chef coat with their name embroidered on!

Had a great experience at CPK tonight. The original wait time was 25 mins but we were seated within 10 mins! Manager was super nice. Loved the Socialite Cosmo cocktail. Shishito Pepper was awesome but spicy. Food as usual good. Bread took a long time to come but our server was very sweet so we didn't mind waiting. The bread was very tasty when it finally came.
Horrible service and has no respect for my birthday and gave me nuts on my cake and my friends candy and also I found a twist tie in my food.

Hostess Megan & Waiter Ron 5STAR .!!!!  Dale the Assistant manager is what the one star is for. we arrived as a party of three and they seated us for a table of 11. As we are walking to our table Dale is looking mad and complaining about us three taking a big table when our entire party hasn't arrived. i'm literally passing by him to my table as he is talking to himself complaining as soon as we sit down he goes to the hostess and he's totally being rude to her and it is so obvious to us that he was getting her in trouble or something for seating us. it was so uncomfortable we even asked to be moved to a smaller table because of the way dale was looking at us all nasty.! thankfully megan told us not to worry and that we could continue waiting for our other party at the same table. since we sat down our party arrived within 10 min and we had barely got our drinks so we weren't backing up  any other guests.! i initially thought wow dale must be the owner because he has baaalllllllsssss to be talking in front of guests like that

The worst taco I had in my life. The fish on my frisbee  sized tortilla was literally the size of my petite thumb. There were three tacos and only one had two pieces of fish. The edges of the tortilla was hard has burnt toast. Never again will I go to this CPK. I've been to so many and never been disappointed like this one. And the older gentleman who was running the bus station needs to be either retrained or repositioned. My second round of tacos came when everyone at my table had finished eating and the kids at my table waiters on there sundae for ever.

Had another amazing meal here! My sis and I ordered the avocado rolls, mushroom and sausage pizza and the butter cake! Ugh everything was like heaven in your mouth! It was warm, fresh off the grill, and delicious.  First of all it was pretty busy inside, but we had to wait at most maybe 10 mins. For it being a busy Saturday we got seated right away! Thank god because we were starving!  Second of all we had an amazing waitress..shoutout to Sarah!! She was patient, timely and cool! So I had a total weird request and wanted a Coke Zero with cherry grenadine, the thought sounded good, but it was gross! I felt bad to ask for a regular cherry Coke since she went out of her way to make this for me, but she was totally cool and professional about it! Then 10 minutes later my sister decides she wants a cherry coke too, and Sarah was still cool About it and was like sure! She really seems like she cares about what she does and meeting the customer needs. So thank you Sarah! You rock!  Will definitely be coming back here again! Especially to have that butter cake again!

I have to start by saying, when I first started going to CPK @ Stoneridge, I wasn't very impressed. That was until Lindsey, Katie, and Kaylee started serving me. All 3 are very professional, and with them, this CPK is by far the best I have ever been too.  You have to try the fish tacos. They're by far the best thing on the menu. Also, Bianca the hostess is the nicest. She's always fast, efficient, and kind.  The food can be very inconsistent.
Not a fan. Pizza dough seemed soft, almost wet which always ruins whatever else might have been going good. This happened two different times to me personally.
Mediocre food. Slow service and can't make a martini. On the plus side: gives military discount.

My daughter and I needed a quick bite to eat this evening after running errands...I was feeling a bit frazzled and rushed, but was instantly greeting by the hostess who gave us a warm welcome and genuine smile...it reminded me to slow down and appreciate that we were about to be seated and would soon be enjoying warm bread and one of our favorite pasta dishes. a.k.a: comfort food. Food and service was great throughout, per usual.  We will keep coming back.

Ok... food was decent, service was good, not a long wait.. my daughter saw carne asada pizza on the adult menu, asked if she could add it to a kids' cheese pizza, which of course was ok... we didn't find out until we got the bill that it nearly doubled the cost of a kids' meal to do that!  I asked the server about it, and got "I'm sorry, it's new." To which I told her that she should inform customers of the exorbitant extra charge in the future, because I wouldn't have ordered that if I had know it would be more than a $2 charge to add 10 cubes of carne asada to a pizza...

Here for family dinner tonight.  I ordered the pesto cream penne, pretty good.  My family ordered the chicken fettuccine scampi. Unless you're not into fettuccine, then u can order that. It's mainly zucchini and shrimp, barely any fettuccine. We sent it right back.

This place is sooooooooooooo good! I thought the salads there would be gross, but I gave it a go, and they were the third best salad I've had in my life. The pastas there are pretty good also. But, the real star of the show is the pizza! The pizza is DELICIOUS!!! The ingredients, you can tell are fresh from the kitchen, not frozen and thawed out. The service is good, waiters and waitresses are friendly, and the restaurant itself is just well decorated, fully painted, and just a good eating environment. I wanted to do a review on this place because today I'm going to a birthday party there for lunch. Anyways, if you don't no where to go, and you want quality made pizza, just come here. :)

Super easy to work with, I had a last minute addition to a medium sized lunch order and they were able to accommodate my request without causing a delay in completing my order. The food is always tasty and I appreciate how hard they work to provide great customer service.

Have not been at CPK's for a long time for various reasons. I visited a regular business in Dublin, not CPK, for years.on a weakly basis..On the recommendation of an associate I tried California Pizza Kitchen in the mall.  I was waited upon and served by Lauren Ino.....  I can not even describe the quality of her service.  The food was great as well.  I will be back as a regular at least once a week.
GM Lauren was phenomenal in making sure my party of 10 was well taken care of. Highly recommend this CPK location for great food and service.

Came here with some coworkers Thursday for dinner. Service was quick and wonderful. Our server was named Michelle and she was so helpful and gave great suggestions when we asked. Also checked in on those suggestions after we got a chance to try them, which was appreciated. Food was really good too! Overall great experience.
Great experience here! They were able to accommodate 10 of us short notice and we had great service! Lauren was so helpful and made sure we were comfortable!
This review is for Celine.  Thank you for your excellent customer service and for being so patient with us when it came to placing our order.  Very friendly and outgoing.

Our experience today was great. Our server was on top of everything. She was very punctual with us and very attentive. Also Lauren I. made the experience even more satisfying. She had great recommendations and made us feel at home. I really appreciate both of there friendliness and service.

Lauren I. was the best ever. Made sure our food was good and came out on time. The desert she recommended was the insanely delicious. Was going to leave without getting it but she talked us into it and I have no regrets

So maybe the husband and I are late to the party... But its a first visit to a CPK... ever, But really enjoyed it!! He got the fettuccine w/shrimp served in a beautiful dish, I got the tortilla rolls w/veggies they were ok served w/a marinara sauce... The complimentary bread was good they could pump up the flavors of the evoo with some herbs or pesto tho... I did ask our server JOE if I could get pesto... he said no, but... That was the only no I got from him...I just gotta say  he was the best server I have had in a restaurant in a very very looooong time, HE WAS AWESOME and turned a 3 star food into a 4 star visit!! I'll be back!!!!!

This place takes too long too take our orders and this makes me starve to death. I rally don't like this place. We waited for about 20 min and still waiting for our damn server to give us waters and take our ours.. It's not even that busy. Most people already got there food, drinks and etc already! Come on! Plus having a 10 yr that's hungry, doesn't help either...

I wanted to do 4 stars because the staff there is really nice from hostess to server to even the chef came out to bring us our food.  They were all so genuinely nice.  What drove the low stars is the food and price.  The food all was great including the flavored lemonades of strawberry and peach.  But for what you paid at $50 for 2 people when both dishes were really greasy and upcharged for adding chicken when there was hardly any, I had to lower it as you are paying for this.    Yes it's the mall but still you are paying and its challenging to do a 20% tip if the food lacks but the staff is great.  You can see they hard working.  The food has to catch-up to the staff.   Pepperoni pizza was greasy which it is but it was really greasy we took a napkin to soak some up as the glisten was too shiny.  I ordered the pesto cream penne with chicken which I've done before and it was fine to charge me for the added chicken.  But when I got it, we had to hunt for where's the chicken.  I wanted to complain (& I don't do that if at all - but there was hardly any chicken strips which they used to give but now they are bits). but the server was so nice we didn't want to cause issues and we were hungry, etc.   I get that they're in the mall and it's nice that they are in the mall for us to seek refuge when it's time to eat.  But I know you do pay a price to have seated service so you should get more with your food at those prices.
I eat a lot of places but this right here is exceptionally bad.... I like all the other locations though but the food at this one is rushed and the service is terrible... three thumbs down 0 stars
I had a door dash delivery and I wanted bread so I messages Diana my dasher & she got right back to me and added it! Very satisfied!

I had the wild mushroom strozapretti (is that how you spell it?) I thought it was good, but had a little too much seasoning. The pizzas were pretty good. They had some fun children's menus lol. Nice atmosphere. Also it was kind of dark. I don't like the dark. Bye.

Excellent service, we like sitting at the bar, big screen tv, stone counter top is always cool and feels good on hot days, great drinks of any kind. Thin crust pizza and cooked salmon that comes out of the pizza oven is awesome. Lots of food options and substitutes available. Management and staff are always polite and friendly.

I walked in after doing shopping at the mall and was able to get a seat at the bar at dinner time.  The server at the bar was friendly and knowledgeable with the menu.  I ordered the chicken milanese.  It was delicious!  The panko-breaded chicken breasts were very tender.  The arugula and tomatoes and parmigiano cheese gave the dish freshness and texture.  It was a healthy dish but full of flavor.  I also appreciated the warm bread that was offered to me.  I could only eat half of the meal, as there were three chicken breasts on my plate.  I took the other half home to enjoy the following day.
The old location was the first CPK I've ever been to, before when it was a "here's your number," so it holds a special place in my heart. I have yet to go to the newer location.

I went to California pizza kitchen earlier today.  Food was good, drinks were okay,  but the service was AWESOME! Rachel was our server. Efficient, friendly,  and had awesome suggestions! Would definitely go back just based on service!

The manager said no dogs allowed at their patio today. Really? I had dinner at their patio numerous times before. Anyway, just an fyi to LMall the dogs owners if you are planning to have dinner here with your dog.

Thank God for CPK because next-door is the cheesecake factory and I would have never been able to get in there. Luckily we were seated within seconds of walking in. The waitstaff was very pleasant and we got our food less than 10 minutes after we ordered. The only thing is I had ordered two crispy mac & cheeses and we didn't get it before our food came. Then I told the waitress to cancel one of the orders and someone else ended up bringing the two of them still. She was nice enough to take one of them off. Overall, I was happy.

I haven't been to CPK in a long time: hubby ordered the Fire-Grilled Ribeye dinner & couldn't stop raving - he loved it. Daughter had the Margherita, she devoured it even tho she wasn't hungry; I had the Cedar Plank Salmon, which was flavorful and not dry, the feta overpowered the corn and succotash though - overall, great and positive experience!

Not sure if it's just this place or CPK in general. But, the food seemed to be very subpar. Service was good, our server was very sweet and attentive to our needs. I wish the food would be a little uplifting rather than heavy and overfilling. The taste has been gone, I'm gonna try a different location before I give up on CPK altogether

I'm not sure if people are just stupid but this place was packed! I placed a phone order while working at Macys, and they transferred me twice to bumbling idiots. Finally I ordered a sausage pizza. No employee discount (Buckhorn gives us a 10% break). They asked how many to serve,  3 was my answer. At that point, they should have told me I would need a microscope to see this most expensive pizza. At the pick up window I was greeted by a sour puss. She took my credit card, threw me my pizza and turned her back on me. I looked in the bag and noticed only one fork, no plates, 2 napkins and a bag with 2 tiny pieces of bread. At this point the experience was so distasteful, I just left knowing this would be Yelped. There was only 7 slices for almost $20. At Bronco Billys in Niles you get a massive slice as big as this pizza with better crust way more sausage and better cheese for only $7. At CPK you do not get value for your buck nor good, friendly service. I kinda remember I came here once long ago and didn't dig it. Now I remember why- it's pure expensive garbage. Won't go back. Don't recommend it. Disgusted.

We had a wonderful and quick dinner here tonight after shopping at Stoneridge.  We were seated after a little wait in a half empty restaurant but that was quickly forgotten when our efficient waiter greeted us! We told him we were in a rush and we literally had the bill in 20 mins which was excellent for our time frame.  I had the Casamigos Strawberry Margarita to drink and it was great!  We had the avocado egg rolls - a must have at CPK for me, I had the Cream Pesto Penne and my girl had the Garlic Cream Pasta. All food was great!

Parking was easy, right across the street! This CPK is clean and the service is good. Our server Danny was amazing and really helpful, she got the waters first, bread and dip second then the drinks and extra napkins. We ordered and she got everything right, I asked for any vegan or vegetarian options and delivered! Over all the experience here was worthy of five stars! The music was good inside the place also! We got a spinach dip as an appetizer, it came out warm and tasting delicious! We also ordered a chicken pasta and it was good from what I heard, my Veggie salad was vegan and that was a huge plus even the dressing is dairy free! Great Peach Lemonade as well!! I love CPK can you tell?

As much as I like to believe I'm getting a deal when I come here with the kids, the fact that they charge me $10.99 for a GLASS of house Chardonnay, and the price I pay after,  makes me feel like if I paid double to a better place I would  rather eat like a Korean BBQ All you can ear I'd be getting more for my money....   You know what I mean...

Visited CPK again last night and once again, my friend & I had an amazing experience.  Thank you Sarah for being so awesome.  I kid you all not, the staff at this CPK location are amazing!  YAY CPK!!!

I think we came here at the wrong time. We were here on a sunday night and the wait to get seated wasnt too bad but their soda machine was down and was making this annoying loud noise then everything else took longer. Servers werent paying attention to their tables and it was just mess.

This was my first CPK experience. I'm confused what the big deal is. Crowded seating, way overpriced, and really bleh food.  I got a zoodle dish, and really, I understand that's a little ridiculous, but for $16 I LITERALLY got a half a zucchini worth of zoodles that were super plain. I decided that mistake was on me, so tried some of my cousin's pizza--cause they probably do that right, right? Nope! It was weird and soggy.  I'll definitely pass on ever going back.

Just wanted to make sure Heidi got the proper recognition. She is such a personable, friendly and amazing representation for the restaurant and CPK is so lucky to have her. My dad and I have dinner together after work every Friday and will almost always choose CPK specifically because of her superb service. The food of course is always great as well. :)

This restaurant is massive.  The place is clean and very inviting.  In addition, staff are professional.  My family and I ordered an array of foods and we are all pleased with the quality and freshness.  I would definitely come again with the family.

Strolled in on a Tuesday evening craving to be here haven't been here in years and I'm so glad We did!  Food selection: custom pizza half the works with pineapple other half chicken artichoke pizza on thin crust  Drinks: the Sangria flight ;strawberry Long Island ice tea  REVIEW: I love everything about this place the food the drinks the ambience this is a causal place for upscale pizza dining they have good food and I like their menu options great pastas salads and pizza I'll be back next time for some pasta so stayed tuned  Service: our server was so accommodating and super cool she vouched for our pizza choice and drink choices and she was on point  great customer service nice personality she even asked us how are food was multiple times which a lot of servers fail to do these days 2 thumbs up;good food snd service go hand and hand I like the way they cook their pizzas perfect everything is so fresh thanks California pizza kitchen for a good experience see ya soon!

Our plans were to go to Cheesecake Factory on a Sat evening after attending the Cal vs USC game. We checked in at 6:00 and was told there would be a wait of 40 min for a party of two. We told the hostess "forget it" and walked over to CPK and was seated right away at the counter. So glad we switched dinner plans!
