This particular CPK is highly organized and top notch among the CPK's that I have eaten at in the past few months (Arden Fair in Sacramento and Emeryville; both are just so-so). The service is fast & efficient, food is delicious and hot. The two managers that I saw working their tail ends off need to be comended for running a superior operation! I saw them pitch hitting and jumping right in to deliver food to the tables. By far, a smooth and efficient team! The chipotle chicken pizza & avocado egg rolls are delish!

I know that a lot of people will find many things to complain about when it comes to chain restaurants/franchises. Luckily for these establishments, I'm the complete opposite and have come to love that I can rely on the consistency of these cookie cutter eateries. This is not an insult- if anything, it's a compliment. I love cookies and the cutters make them into cute shapes.  On to my actual review! I've been to a few CPKs before. But this had to be the most upscale lounge location. Then again, I haven't been to one in so long- so that's probably also the reasoning behind my (pleasant) surprise. There are many dining options at Stoneridge mall. What I love about this place is that it's the perfect middle to the higher end Cheesecake Factory and the ever so approachable McDonald's or subway.  My go-to here is always the Cobb salad. You can't go wrong with it. Luckily for me, I was having lunch with one of my favorite people. We both love to order from every section of the menu, as realistically as possible. Especially when everything looks and sounds so delicious.  Even though we ordered two appetizers and an entree salad to share, everything came out at the same time. We were so lucky because it was a Sunday afternoon, at noon. There was no wait and we were immediately seated in a booth.  When the food came, we didn't hesitate to dig in. The spicy buffalo cauliflower had just the right amount of tang, crunch, and creaminess. The sauce can build up in spicy hotness since they use Sriracha in it. So maybe the children should steer clear of this one. The thing I loved most about this plate was the surprisingly garlicky kick. I can't get enough garlic, so we ended up dipping the (complimentary) bread in it too.  The shaved mushroom and spinach flatbread satiated our hungry stomachs. It was so fragrant, but mot overpowering. The mushrooms weren't watery and so they gave a nice, thin meaty texture to complement the crispy bread base.  Lastly, the reliable old California Cobb salad. We got a full entree portion. Everything was eaten family style, so we were stuffed. We didn't opt for dessert because we wanted to stop by Quickly for some boba a bit later on. Which we did.  This is a really great alternative for when Cheesecake Factory is completely crowded. And even when it's crowded at CPK, you can call and order to go. Win, win.

We went there for lunch and took the waitress 20min to show up and take our order, it was around 3pm so it wasn't busy took another 30min for our food to arrive. They don't have anything for kids specially French fries burgers or buffalo wings smh.... won't go there again

California Pizza KItchen's rating is an iffy call. granted i was only interested in the pizza,  offerings: pastas, salads, mains, appetitzers, power bowls, lunch duos,.crispy thin pizza and gluten-free pizza. what i ordered is considered "original hand tossed pizza". eats: "five cheese + fresh tomato" (12.99) -pizza cut unevenly, sliced quarters and eighths. -fresh and traditional ,mozzarrella, romano. gouda, monterey jack cheeses.. -crust chewy, ok for an hand tossed pizza  -too salty, tasted primarily of an aged cheese,  needs a new mix. recipe falters in competition with true Italian pizza classics. -comped baked bread and olive oil dip, interesting, is Cali Pizza Italian? menu says yes. take outs:  -California Pizza disappointed in the product served. thought it would be a superior product. just above average. -service is uber.  got strategic checkins, non intrusive, tolerable. -pink t-shirts? most understated workware i've seen. fine with me. who's courtney? mentioned on the backside of t-shirt..btw not looking for hooter wannabees, just the writing on the tees.  -would repeat due to supreme service, not due to food, can always get recommendations. hopefully the waitstaff keeps up the fab work to keep this chain going until they get the recipes right.

Was disappointed on service.  Food was good but waiter already asked if we need a box, gave the check while we're not done eating yet.  I still have half of the stuff on my plate.  I eat slow & like to enjoy my meal & not feel like i'm being rushed  wow!

Our family comes here every week almost. Until the change of management everything went down. Just today we went for lunch. Great meal/service and our waitress Summer was the best. She took care of us and even introduced us to ranch with our pizzas and it was delicious! Will definitely be having those two together again.

Nice upscale pizza/italian  restaurant. Quaint ambiance for a hot date or a sunday family dinner. Lots of seating for large or small groups...went here for after work drinks while doing a lil shopping...I will update with a food review soon
Dude they are slow asf. I wouldn't recommend. There are way better pizza joints near by. But i will admit their bbq chicken pizza is smack.

Came here at Black Friday 2017 around 1:30PM. Compared to our usual CPK branch in Valley Fair this branch is very efficient. The place was very busy but we were seated in less than 20mins. People who work here are well trained including our server Michelle. The guy at the front knows his job, most wait is 20 minutes or less. Tables are clean as soon as the customer leaves without feeling being rushed. Most importantly, the quality of food was even better, Waldorf Salad was perfect and Sicilian Pizza served crispy and hot not burned.  Truly impressed with the management of this restaurant.

Never eaten at this CPK but I will definitely be going back again because of their outstanding service. Ordered the Shrimp Scampi and Sangria flight for lunch with my mom. Both were good. But more importantly hats off and Kuddos to my server Bryant! He was very nice and delivered  a great experience for us that we will not hesitate to go back. The Managers were very friendly and delivered great service as well. They came by to check in with us to make sure everything was ok.

I never win on a raffle tickets but my little son won a $50 gift card for this restaurant at his school.Lucky boy lol This is my second time here at this restaurant. First time I thought it was just okay but today we had a good meal , good service and we enjoyed our dinner with dessert. We are always going to Cheesecake Factory next door but now I can come here.

We love CPK and it's our monthly visit after LEGO Built. We usually would rate this restaurant four stars. Food is good and great customer service. Food pictures taken a few months ago.

Haven't been to Stoneridge in years and I finally come back and find that CPK has not only moved locations but they've also EXPANDED. Their menu also appeared to have added some more items.  From what I remember back then - your options were pretty much limited to pizza or a mac and cheese, salad (and perhaps a fettucine alfredo). Now they've got Pesto Penne pasta with your choice of adding chicken, shrimp or ... I can't remember the last selection (sorry. LOL). I went for the shrimp and it was delicious! I could really taste the ground pine nuts in the sauce and it was fine, creamy and delicious.  I would totally go back to CPK just for the penne pesto dish!

Always a good place to eat definitely a step above applebee's, Olive Garden an Danny's.  The menu is always known. The way they cook their chicken or food is always the same way no matter who cooks it.
Food was good but it took a long time to arrive that it was already cold!  Waitress never checked up on us and our knife and plate were damaged.  See pic

I have been to this CPK several times before. I always have a great experience here and at CPKs in general. I like how warm and welcoming the staff are. Lately I have been eating at the bar because service is faster and it's nice sitting in the high chairs. The bartender who served me was very kind. This CPK is very clean, organized and they staff is very friendly and works hard to make sure you have an excellent experience. It has a nice, relaxed ambience and I love sitting at the bar with the open kitchen. It's really fun to see how the pizza is made! :) I decided to order the lunch special (11am-4pm) which starts at $8.95. I went with the smashed meatball dish with the Sedona tortilla soup which was only $10.95 I believe. It was so delicious and it is like a lighter calzone that is very filling with the Sedona tortilla soup which was scrumptious! She even offered me some bread and their bread and olive oil dip is always so good!! Molto bene!! Lol. :) Overall, it was really good! I also had their water which is Acqua Panna in the 1/2 liter ($3.79). Acqua Panna is so crisp and refreshing and they serve it in a wine glass with lime. This is my favorite place to go and unwind. I love CPK. I should probably get their rewards card, lol since I love going here. :)

CPK is usually pretty busy as It is located right outside of stoneridge mall, so right after or before a trip to the mall many people come here to eat. They are known for their pizza's and It is great, however the food here does take a while since It is a pretty big place. When I came last time, my food was cold and It was hard to get my waiters attention since she was managing so many tables at once. It is an average place but It is fairly pricy for dinner as my spaghetti bolognese was somewhere around $14-$18.

Haven't been to CPK in a while. There's always a crowd. Came here with the bf on a Friday night after doing a little shopping. We went to sit at the bar because we didn't want to wait for a table. Luis was serving that area (about 10-12 stools maybe) and asked us if we wanted anything to drink. I got a Fresh Strawberry Mango Cooler while the bf ordered a Blue Moon. He brought us bread with olive oil about 15 mins later. So, we ordered a classic dish "Roasted Garlic Chicken Pizza" and also tried something new, "Chile-Braised Short Ribs + Chipotle Mac n' Cheese." The pizza was good; simple ingredients but flavorful due to the garlic & scallions if ya like that. The short ribs mac n' cheese was alright for me. Tasted kind of smoky. You'd probably like it if you like smoked dishes lol. Anyway, I'd also recommend the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine, Sicilian Pizza, Spinach Artichoke Dip or BBQ Chicken Pizza.

This is a favorite place to get pizza in Pleasanton. I love the base and range of veggy toppings.  They are always quick to top up drinks and take away dirty plates.  Service is always good.  Shout out to Rachel who took care of us yesterday, who had a big smile and great attitude.

Sarah did an excellent job making recommendations and meeting our needs as they came up.  The pizza was excellent. The Cheese, and pepperoni pizzas were tasty and hot.  The veggie was good but had to many mushrooms to my liking.  However, it was still delicious.  Sarah even offered to have it remade  with less mushrooms!!  I'll will be coming here again!!
Service was ok. Server seemed to have disappeared. The desserts took longer to come than the appetizer or the main course. The food was good, but the service was a huge negative.
